{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Erik Lamela | image = Lamela CSKA Tott 2016 (cropped).JPG | image_size = 200 | caption = Lamela playing for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in 2016 | fullname = Erik Manuel Lamela<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/FootballFicheJoueur41668.html |title=Erik Lamela |newspaper=L'Équipe |location=Paris |accessdate=15 February 2019 |language=fr}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1992|3|4}}<ref name=Hugman>{{Hugman|26213|Erik Lamela|accessdate=15 February 2019}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Buenos Aires]], Argentina | height = 1.83 m<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.dfb.de/datencenter/personen/erik-lamela/spieler |title=Erik Lamela |publisher=German Football Association |accessdate=6 February 2019 |language=de}}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder#Winger|Winger]], [[attacking midfielder]]<ref name="Hotspurs_profile">{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/first-team-squad/erik-lamela/ |title=Erik Lamela |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |accessdate=8 December 2016}}</ref> | currentclub = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | clubnumber = 11 | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] | years1 = 2009–2011 | clubs1 = [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] | caps1 = 36 | goals1 = 4 | clubs2 = [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] | years2 = 2011–2013 | caps2 = 62 | goals2 = 19 | clubs3 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | years3 = 2013– | caps3 = <!--LEAGUE ONLY-->128<!--LEAGUE ONLY--> | goals3 = <!--LEAGUE ONLY-->14<!--LEAGUE ONLY--> | nationalyears1 = 2011–2012 | nationalteam1 = [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 3 | nationalyears2 = 2011– | nationalteam2 = [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] | nationalcaps2 = 25 | nationalgoals2 = 3 | club-update = 14:32, 14 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 03:42, 21 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Erik Manuel Lamela''' ({{IPA-es|ˈeɾik laˈmela}}; born 4 March 1992) is an Argentine professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as an [[attacking midfielder]] or [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] for English {{English football updater|TottenhH}} club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and the [[Argentina national football team|Argentina national team]].
He began his career at [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] and in 2011 transferred to [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] for an initial €12 million. After two [[Serie A]] seasons he joined Tottenham for a fee of £25.8 million. A full international since 2011, he was part of the Argentine squad which finished as runners-up at the [[2015 Copa América]].
==Early life== After he had joined River Plate as a seven-year old, [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] reportedly offered Lamela and his family £100,000 a year, as well as a house and employment for his parents, to move to the city of [[Barcelona]], in a similar deal to the one that saw [[Lionel Messi]] move to Spain as a youngster.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/425727/WATCH-Tottenham-s-Erik-Lamela-spurned-Barcelona-as-a-child |title=Tottenham's Erik Lamela spurned Barcelona as a child |work=Express |publisher=Express |accessdate=30 August 2012}}</ref> In 2004, a ''[[Trans World Sport]]'' film crew travelled to Argentina to interview a 12-year-old Lamela who was already making headlines after scoring 120 goals for River Plate's youth side the previous season. In the video, Lamela declares his wish to follow in the footsteps of [[Diego Maradona]] and win a [[FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] for Argentina.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ric0xTz5g2A |title=12-year-old Erik Lamela on Trans World Sport |work=YouTube |publisher=Youtube |accessdate=21 April 2013}}</ref>
==Club career==
===River Plate=== Lamela made his first team debut for [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] on 14 June 2009 in a game against [[Club Atlético Tigre|Tigre]] for the [[2008–09 Argentine Primera División season#Torneo Clausura|2009 Clausura tournament]]. He entered the field on the 80th minute, substituting [[Robert Mario Flores|Robert Flores]]. Lamela scored his first goal for River on 5 December 2010 in a match against [[Club Atlético Colón|Colón]] for the [[2010–11 Argentine Primera División season#Torneo Apertura|Apertura tournament]]. He scored his second goal against [[Club Atlético Lanús|Lanús]] in the final fixture of that Apertura, helping River win the match 4–2.
The midfielder was a regular starter for River during the [[2010–11 Argentine Primera División season]], playing 34 games and scoring four goals.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.argentinesoccer.com/player.cfm?id=lmla |title=Profile |publisher=Argentine Soccer |accessdate=27 July 2011}}</ref> He helped his team to finish in an overall sixth place that would have qualified them for the [[2011 Copa Sudamericana]]. Due to the relegation format of the Argentine Primera that accounts a team's last three seasons, however, River was relegated after losing a playoff with [[Club Atlético Belgrano|Belgrano]].
===Roma=== ====2011–12 season==== [[File:Oscar Chelsea vs AS-Roma 10AUG2013.JPG|thumb|right|Lamela (r.) playing for Roma against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in August 2013]]
On 6 August 2011, Lamela joined Italian club [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] of [[Serie A]] for a fee of €12 million, plus €2 million in bonuses, which was activated after his 20th club appearance.<ref name=Romacontract>{{cite web |url=http://www.asroma.it/pdf/corporate/operazioni_di_mercato/2011-08-06_acquisizione_a_titolo_definitivo_dei_diritti_alle_prestazioni_sportive_del_calciatore_erik_manuel_lamela.pdf |title=Acquisizione a titolo definitivo dei diritti alle prestazioni sportive del calciatore Erik Manuel Lamela |publisher=asroma.it |accessdate=6 August 2011 |language=Italian}}</ref> Roma also paid an additional €3.2 million to Orel B.V.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.asroma.it/pdf/corporate/comunicati_finanziari/2012_31_10_as_relazione_finanziaria_annuale_al_30_giugno_2012.pdf |title=Relazione Finanziaria annuale al 30 giugno 2012 |date=31 October 2012 |accessdate=30 August 2013 |publisher=AS Roma |language=Italian}}</ref> — plus 10% added value if the player was later sold above €12 million — and €3.06 million in the form of taxes to the Government of Argentina. Lamela signed a 5-year contract worth €1.8 million in gross in the first season, but would gradually increase by €350,000 on 1 July 2012 (to €2.15M), 2014 (€2.5M) and 2015 (€2.85M).<ref name=Romacontract/> On 23 October 2011, he scored his first goal in Serie A against [[U.S. Città di Palermo|Palermo]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/327134/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=3436 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130828112219/http://espnfc.com/en/report/327134/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=3436 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=28 August 2013 |title=AS Roma 1–0 Palermo |work=ESPN |publisher=Entertainment and Sports Programming Network |accessdate=23 October 2011}}</ref> Later, he scored goals against [[U.S. Lecce|Lecce]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/326903/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=3436 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130828113445/http://espnfc.com/en/report/326903/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=3436 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=28 August 2013 |title=Lecce 4–2 AS Roma |work=ESPN |publisher=Entertainment and Sports Programming Network |accessdate=7 April 2012}}</ref> [[Novara Calcio|Novara]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/326912/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=3436 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130828113418/http://espnfc.com/en/report/326912/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=3436 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=28 August 2013 |title=Europe close in on AS Roma |work=ESPN |publisher=Entertainment and Sports Programming Network |accessdate=1 April 2012}}</ref> and [[A.C. Cesena|Cesena]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/326832/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=3436 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130828113500/http://espnfc.com/en/report/326832/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=3436 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=28 August 2013 |title=De Rossi earns win |work=ESPN |publisher=Entertainment and Sports Programming Network |accessdate=14 May 2012}}</ref> Lamela ended his first season at the [[Stadio Olimpico]] with six goals in 31 games in all competitions.
====2012–13 season==== Lamela began the [[2012–13 Serie A|2012–13 season]] well, his first goal of the season coming against [[Bologna F.C. 1909|Bologna]] on 16 September 2012. Lamela hit a superb patch of form in October and early November, scoring seven goals in six games, including a brace against [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] in a 3–2 home defeat and goals against [[Atalanta B.C.|Atalanta]], [[Genoa C.F.C.|Genoa]], [[Parma F.C.|Parma]], and [[U.S. Città di Palermo|Palermo]]. He also scored a goal in the [[Derby della Capitale]] against [[S.S. Lazio|Lazio]]. After almost a month out with an ankle ligament injury, he returned to the field and scored a brace against [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] in a 4–2 victory on 22 December.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/88222/roma-vs-ac-milan/report? |title=Roma 4–2 AC Milan: Ragged Rossoneri leave it too late against 10-man Giallorossi |publisher=Goal.com |date=22 December 2012 |accessdate=30 August 2013}}</ref>
Lamela went on to score 15 times in 33 games, putting him joint-fifth in Serie A and second to striker [[Dani Osvaldo|Pablo Osvaldo]] (16 goals) at Roma.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/stats/scorers?league=ita.1&year=2012 |title=Italian Serie A Goal Scoring Leaders – 2012–13 |work=ESPN |publisher=Entertainment and Sports Programming Network |accessdate=25 August 2012}}</ref> Lamela's and Roma's season, however, ended in heartache with defeat to [[Rome]] rivals Lazio in the [[2012–13 Coppa Italia|Coppa Italia]] final, coupled with finishing sixth in Serie A, meaning that Roma would not play [[UEFA|European]] football for the second consecutive season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/106534/roma-vs-lazio/report? |title=Roma 0–1 Lazio: Biancocelesti edge dour derby to claim Coppa Italia |publisher=Goal.com |date=26 May 2013 |accessdate=30 August 2013}}</ref>
===Tottenham Hotspur=== On 30 August 2013, [[Premier League]] club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] completed the transfer of Lamela from Roma for a deal worth an initial £25.8 million, plus up to £4.2 million in bonus payments.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://twitter.com/SpursOfficial/status/373444642198405121 |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur Twitter |accessdate=30 August 2013 |title=We are delighted to announce that we've reached agreement with AS Roma for the transfer of Erik Lamela}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23903926 |title=Erik Lamela: Tottenham confirm the signing of Roma forward |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 August 2013 |accessdate=30 August 2013}}</ref> The fee for Lamela made him the most expensive player in the club's history, breaking the two previous records that had been set earlier in the transfer window, first for [[Paulinho (footballer)|Paulinho]] and then [[Roberto Soldado]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2404513/Tottenham-seal-30m-Erik-Lamela-AS-Roma.html |title=Tottenham seal £30m Lamela deal to complete hat-trick of club record transfers |publisher=Daily Mail |date=29 August 2013 |accessdate=30 August 2013}}</ref>
====2013–14 season==== On 1 September, Lamela made his debut for Tottenham as a 75th-minute substitute in a 1–0 [[North London derby]] loss to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] at the [[Emirates Stadium]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23831033 |title=Arsenal 1–0 Tottenham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 September 2013 |accessdate=1 September 2013 |first=Alistair |last=Magowan}}</ref> On 19 September, he made his first start for Tottenham against [[Tromsø IL]] in the [[2013–14 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]], assisting [[Jermain Defoe]] for Tottenham's opening goal in a 3–0 win at [[White Hart Lane]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/tottenham-hotspur/10321158/Tottenham-Hotspur-3-Tromso-0-match-report.html |title=Tottenham Hotspur 3 Tromso 0: match report |date=20 September 2013 |accessdate=22 April 2014 |work=The Daily Telegraph}}</ref> On 22 September, he assisted Paulinho's stoppage-time winning goal after appearing as a substitute in Tottenham's 1–0 win at [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/24098608 |title=Cardiff 0–1 Tottenham |date=22 September 2013 |accessdate=22 April 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
On 29 October, with Lamela having yet to start a Premier League match, Tottenham manager [[André Villas-Boas]] said of the player, "He knows he isn't producing half of what he can produce, but he understands the situation now is that he has to compete for his place."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://espnfc.com/news/story/_/id/1598356/tottenham-boss-andre-villas-boas-admits-erik-lamela-form-struggles?cc=3436 |title=Villas-Boas admits Lamela struggles |date=29 November 2013 |accessdate=22 April 2014 |work=ESPN}}</ref> On 7 November, Lamela scored his first goal for the club in a 2–1 Europa League win against [[FC Sheriff Tiraspol|Sheriff Tiraspol]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/nov/07/tottenham-hotspur-sheriff-europa-league |title=Tottenham's Jermain Defoe breaks club scoring record in win over Sheriff |date=8 November 2013 |accessdate=22 April 2014 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> Seventeen days later, he made his first start in the Premier League as Tottenham were beaten 6–0 by [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/24976958 |title=Man City 6–0 Tottenham Hotspur |date=24 November 2013 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> His season was ended by a back injury in April 2014.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27070007 |title=Erik Lamela: Injured Tottenham midfielder to miss end of season |date=17 April 2014 |accessdate=22 April 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== Under [[Mauricio Pochettino]], Tottenham's new Argentine manager, Lamela was named in the starting line-up for the opening match of the [[2014–15 Premier League]] season against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], making his first appearance of 2014.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/aug/20/erik-lamela-written-off-one-poor-season |title=Erik Lamela should not be written off on the basis of one poor season |date=20 August 2014 |accessdate=23 August 2014 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> On 21 August, he appeared from the bench in Spurs' [[2014–15 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]] match at [[AEL Limassol|AEL]] and assisted goals for [[Roberto Soldado]] and [[Harry Kane]] to secure a 2–1 win against the Cypriot club.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2014-15/aug/europa-league-review-220814.html |title=Europa League: Lamela comes to Spurs rescue |date=22 August 2014 |accessdate=23 August 2014 |work=Premier League}}</ref> He then recorded two more assists in a 4–0 win over [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] three days later at White Hart Lane.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28824594 |title=Lamela shines in 4–0 win |date=24 August 2014 |accessdate=8 September 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
Lamela scored his first goals of the season on 23 October, a brace in a 5–1 victory over Greek club [[Asteras Tripoli F.C.|Asteras Tripoli]] in the Europa League.<ref name="Asteras Tripoli">{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29730663 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 5–1 Asteras Tripolis |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 October 2014 |accessdate=23 October 2014}}</ref> His first goal was a [[rabona]]-style strike from outside the area, the goal being praised by the [[BBC]] as brilliant and by [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]] as "world-class."<ref name="Asteras Tripoli" /><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.itv.com/europa-league/replay-lamela-with-a-world-class-rabona |title=Replay: Lamela with a world class rabona |work=ITV |date=23 October 2014 |accessdate=23 October 2014}}</ref> He scored his first Premier League goal on 20 December in a 2–1 win against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] at White Hart Lane.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30459791 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 2–1 Burnley |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 December 2014 |accessdate=23 December 2014 |first=Mark |last=Higginson}}</ref>
====2015–16 season==== Lamela's first goal of the [[2015–16 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2015–16 season]] came in a 3–1 [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]] win over [[Qarabağ FK]] on 17 September 2015. On 26 September, he scored his first Premier League goal of the season in a 4–1 home victory over [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34299624 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 4–1 Manchester City |date=26 September 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=27 September 2015 |first=Mandeep |last=Sanghera}}</ref> Lamela scored his first career hat-trick as Tottenham thrashed [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] 4–1 in the Europa League on 10 December.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35055753 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 4–1 Monaco |date=10 December 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=11 December 2015 |first=Marc |last=Higginson}}</ref>
====2016–17 season==== Lamela scored with a second half header on the opening day of the [[2016–17 Premier League|2016–17 season]] in a 1–1 draw against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at [[Goodison Park]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36994878 |title=Everton 1–1 Tottenham Hotspur |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 August 2016 |accessdate=13 August 2016}}</ref> However, a hip injury in late October left him unfit for matches for a long period and ended his season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/jan/06/tottenham-erik-lamela-return-roma-hip-injury |title=Tottenham’s Érik Lamela returns to Roma for treatment on hip injury |first=David |last=Hytner |date=6 January 2017 |work=The Guardian |accessdate=7 January 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39437112 |title=Erik Lamela: Tottenham midfielder out for the season |date=29 March 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=31 March 2017}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== After more than a year out due to the hip injury that required two operations,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/nov/29/tottenham-erik-lamela-feared-never-play-again-injury-pochettino |title=Tottenham’s Érik Lamela admits he feared he would never play again |first=Stuart |last=James |date=29 November 2017 |work=The Guardian}}</ref> Lamela appeared in the Premier League away game against Leicester on 28 November 2017 as a substitute. He assisted in the only goal for Spurs, but the game ended in a 2–1 loss.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/11/28/leicester-2-tottenham-1-jamie-vardy-strikes-100th-league-goal/ |title=Leicester 2 Tottenham 1: Jamie Vardy strikes 100th league goal as hosts extinguish Spurs' title dreams |first=Jason |last=Burt |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=28 November 2017}}</ref> He followed that up with his first league start of the season in a 2–0 home win against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton]] on 13 December 2017.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/12/13/tottenham-2-brighton-0-serge-auriers-fluke-helps-send-spurs/ |title=Tottenham 2 Brighton 0: Serge Aurier's fluke helps send Spurs back into top four |first=Matt |last=Law |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=13 December 2017}}</ref> He scored his first goal of the season in the 2–0 win against [[Newport County A.F.C.|Newport County]] in the fourth round replay of the [[2017–18 FA Cup|FA Cup]] on 7 February 2018.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42882967 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 2–0 Newport County |date=7 February 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Michael |last=Pearlman |accessdate=8 February 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== On 20 July 2018, Lamela signed a new four-year extension to his contract with Tottenham until 2022.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44902811 |title=Tottenham Hotspur: Son Heung-min & Erik Lamela sign new contracts |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 July 2018 |accessdate=21 July 2018}}</ref>
Lamela scored his first goal of the [[2018–19 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2018–19 season]] after coming on as a substitute in the game against Liverpool that Spurs lost 2–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/09/15/tottenham-vs-liverpool-premier-league-live-score-updates/ |title=Liverpool make it five in a row by tearing error-prone Tottenham wide open |first=Matt |last=Law |first2=Rob |last2=Bagchi |work=The Telegraph |date=15 September 2018}}</ref> He also scored in the next league game against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton]] in a 2–1 win,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/tottenham-brighton-premier-league-match-report-erik-lamela-a8550626.html |title=Erik Lamela guides wasteful Tottenham to nervy win over Brighton |first=Jack |last=Pitt-Brooke |work=The Independent |date=22 September 2018}}</ref> followed by another goal in the next game in the [[2018–19 EFL Cup|EFL Cup]] against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/tottenham-vs-watford-live-efl-cup-2018-as-it-happened-spurs-win-shootout-a3946681.html |title=Tottenham vs Watford LIVE: EFL Cup 2018 as it happened - Spurs win shootout |first=Malik |last=Ouzia |date=26 September 2018 |work=The Evening Standard}}</ref> On 3 October, Lamela scored Tottenham's second goal in a 4–2 defeat at home to [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in the [[2018–19 UEFA Champions League group stage]]; it was the 8,000th goal in the history of the Champions League.<ref>{{cite news |first=Anthony |last=Chapman |title=Uefa announce Erik Lamela scored the 8,000th Champions League goal after 'database error' accidentally handed honour to Antoine Griezmann |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/7419194/erik-lamela-antoine-griezmann-champions-league-8000th-goal/ |work=The Sun |publisher=News Group Newspapers |date=4 October 2018 |accessdate=4 October 2018}}</ref> He made his first league start of the season in the away match against [[West Ham United]], scoring the only goal that secured a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/10/20/spurs-battle-past-combative-west-ham-continue-winning-ways/ |title=Tottenham battle past combative West Ham to continue winning ways |first=Sam |last=Dean |date=20 October 2018 |work=The Daily Telegraph}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Argentina NT team line-up against Uruguay.jpg|thumb|right|Lamela (4th from right) lining up with Argentina against Uruguay.]]
Lamela took part in the [[2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] with the [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina national under-20 team]] and scored three goals in four matches.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/statisticsandrecords/players/player=330540/index.html |title=Erik Lamela |publisher=FIFA |accessdate=14 August 2011}}</ref>
Lamela made his debut with the [[Argentina national football team|Argentina national team]] on 25 May 2011 in a friendly game against [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2011/05/25/world/friendlies/argentina/paraguay/1104756/ |title=Argentina vs. Paraguay 4 – 2 |work=SoccerWay |publisher=SoccerWay |accessdate=25 May 2011}}</ref>
On 3 September 2014, Lamela scored his first goal for the senior national team, putting Argentina 2–0 ahead against [[Germany national football team|Germany]], in an eventual 4–2 win in a rematch of the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final|World Cup final]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/sep/04/germany-argentina-friendly-dusseldorf |title=Argentina avenge their World Cup final defeat with destruction of Germany |work=The Guardian |date=3 September 2014 |accessdate=24 October 2014}}</ref>
In May 2015, Lamela was selected by coach [[Gerardo Martino]] in Argentina's squad for the [[2015 Copa América]] held in Chile.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://canchallena.lanacion.com.ar/1796405-gerardo-martino-confirmo-la-lista-de-23-convocados-y-mantuvo-a-casco-para-la-copa-america |title=Gerardo Martino confirmó la lista de 23 convocados y mantuvo a Casco para la Copa América |date=27 May 2015 |accessdate=27 May 2015 |publisher=[[La Nación]]}}</ref>
In 2016, Lamela was selected by coach [[Gerardo Martino]] in Argentina's squad for the [[2016 Copa América]]. Lamela was part of [[Argentina national football team|the Argentine side]] that ran to [[Copa América Centenario Final|the final]]. He appeared in all of Argentina's group stage matches, and scored a goal in the 3–0 win against [[Bolivia national football team|Bolivia]] with a long range free kick.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2016/06/15/tottenhams-erik-lamela-posts-picture-after-goal-for-argentina/ |title=Tottenham's Erik Lamela posts picture after goal for Argentina |first=Che |last=Thomas |work=HITC |date=15 June 2016}}</ref> He scored again in the 4–1 win in the quarter final against [[Venezuela national football team|Venezuela]] minutes after coming on as a sub.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-soccer-copa-arg-ven/messi-matches-record-as-argentina-win-copa-quarter-final-idUKKCN0Z500Q |title=Messi matches record as Argentina win Copa quarter-final |first=Andrew |last=Downie |work=Reuters |date=19 June 2016}}</ref> In [[Copa América Centenario Final|the final]] against [[Chile national football team|Chile]], he only appeared as a sub in extra-time in the 111th minute, which Chile won 4–2 on [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalties]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/copa-america-final-live-score-8290131 |title=Copa America final RECAP: All the action as it happened as Argentina faced Chile at MetLife Stadium |work=The Daily Mirror |authors==Alex Richards, Paul McConnell |date=27 June 2016}}</ref>
In November 2018, Lamela was recalled to the Argentina national team after a two-year absence.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/erik-lamela-motivated-by-argentina-return-during-careerthreatening-tottenham-layoff-a3990121.html |title=Lamela motivated by Argentina return during career-threatening lay-off |work=Evening Standard |accessdate=18 November 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref>
==Personal life== Lamela's girlfriend of many years is Sofia Herrero.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.thesportreview.com/2016/10/tottenham-wags-christian-eriksen-erik-lamela-harry-kanes-girlfriends-and-wives/7/ |title=Tottenham WAGs: Meet Christian Eriksen, Erik Lamela and Harry Kane’s girlfriends |work=Sport Review |date=30 October 2016}}</ref> Their son Tobias was born on 25 November 2017.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.football.london/tottenham-hotspur-fc/players/erik-lamela-kane-trippier-fatherhood-13965526 |title=Erik Lamela's new baby – will fatherhood treat Spurs star like Harry Kane and Kieran Trippier? |first=Alasdair |last=Gold |work=Football London |date=28 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jan/26/eric-lamela-tottenham-brother-wheelchair |title=Érik Lamela: 'My brother is in a wheelchair ... you realise what is important' |first=David |last=Hytner |date=26 January 2018 |work=The Guardian}}</ref>

{{EngvarB|date=August 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Victor Wanyama | image = Victor Wanyama 20170820.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Wanyama playing for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in 2017 | fullname = Victor Mugubi Wanyama<ref>{{cite web |title=List of players under written contract transferred between 01/07/2016 and 31/07/2016 |url=http://www.thefa.com/-/media/files/thefaportal/governance-docs/registrations/player-registration---july-2016.ashx |publisher=The Football Association |format=PDF |page=37 |accessdate=16 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1991|6|25|df=y}}<ref name="V. Wanyama">{{cite web|title=Victor Wanyama|url=http://www.goal.com/en/people/kenya/57998/victor-wanyama|publisher=Goal.com|accessdate=12 February 2015}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Nairobi]], Kenya | height = 1.88 m<ref>{{cite web |title=Victor Wanyama |url=http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=58053 |publisher=Soccerbase |accessdate=23 September 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|Defensive midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | clubnumber = 12 | youthyears1 = 2006–2008 | youthyears2 = 2006 | youthyears3 = 2006–2007 | youthyears4 = 2007–2008 | youthclubs1 = JMJ Youth Academy | youthclubs2 = [[Nairobi City Stars]] | youthclubs3 = [[AFC Leopards]] | youthclubs4 = [[Helsingborgs IF|Helsingborg]] | years1 = 2008–2011 | clubs1 = [[Beerschot AC|Beerschot]] | caps1 = 51 | goals1 = 2 | years2 = 2011–2013 | clubs2 = [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] | caps2 = 61 | goals2 = 10 | years3 = 2013–2016 | clubs3 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | caps3 = 85 | goals3 = 4 | years4 = 2016– | clubs4 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | caps4 = 60 | goals4 = 5 | nationalyears1 = 2007– | nationalteam1 = [[Kenya national football team|Kenya]] | nationalcaps1 = 52 | nationalgoals1 = 5 | pcupdate = 14:46, 14 March 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 14 October 2018 }}
'''Victor Mugubi Wanyama''' ({{IPA-all|wɑˈɲɑːmɑ|[[Kenyan English]]:|Victor Mugubi Wanyama.ogg}}; born 25 June 1991) is a Kenyan professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and captains the [[Kenya national football team|Kenyan national team]].<ref name="Captain">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/23267053 |title=Celtic's Victor Wanyama has joined Southampton, say Kenyans |work=BBC Sport |date=11 July 2013 |accessdate=20 September 2014 }}</ref>
Wanyama became the first ever Kenyan player to score in the [[UEFA Champions League]] when he scored the first goal in [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]]'s 2–1 win over [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] on 7 November 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/world-match-centre/news/newsid/224/652/3/ |title=Wanyama: Saints' sights on Europe |work=FIFA |date=17 December 2013 |accessdate=20 September 2014 }}</ref> On 11 July 2013, Wanyama moved to Premier League club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] for £12.5 million making him the most expensive player sold by a Scottish club, surpassing the £9.5 million Russian club [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] paid for [[Aiden McGeady]] in 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/world-match-centre/nationalleagues/nationalleague=england-premier-league-2000000000/news/newsid/213/511/7/index.html |title=Southampton in record swoop for Wanyama |work=FIFA |date=11 July 2013 |accessdate=20 September 2014 }}</ref>
He has earned over 50 caps for the [[Kenya national football team|Kenyan national team]] since making his international debut in May 2007 at the age of 15.
== Early life == Wanyama attended Kamukunji High School, which fields a successful football team. Upon leaving High School, he also played with JMJ Academy for three years during which time he also joined [[Kenyan Premier League]] clubs [[Nairobi City Stars]] and [[AFC Leopards]].<ref name=Cement>[http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/sports/InsidePage.php?id=2000000305&cid=38&story=Mugabe%20wants%20to%20cement%20position%20in%20Belgium%20club Mugabe wants to cement position in Belgium club] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304132405/http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/sports/InsidePage.php?id=2000000305&cid=38&story=Mugabe%20wants%20to%20cement%20position%20in%20Belgium%20club |date=4 March 2016 }} Standard Digital, 5 January 2010</ref> In 2007, he joined [[Allsvenskan]] club [[Helsingborgs IF|Helsingborg]] but after the departure of his brother [[McDonald Mariga]] to [[Serie A]] side [[Parma F.C.|Parma]] in 2008, Wanyama returned to Kenya.
== Club career ==
=== Beerschot AC === After a successful trial, Wanyama signed for [[K. Beerschot AC|Beerschot AC]] on a four-year contract in summer 2008. He made his debut in a League match at the end of the [[2008–09 Belgian First Division|2008–09 season]]. In September 2009, he was fined €100 and given a three-match suspension for a violent tackle on [[Matías Suárez]] of [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]].<ref>[http://www.footgoal.net/suite.php?selection=44838 Wanyama suspendu trois matchs (Wanyama suspended three games)] {{webarchive|url=https://www.webcitation.org/6AV6dTJkR?url=http://www.footgoal.net/suite.php?selection=44838 |date=7 September 2012 }} Footgoal, 29 September 2009 {{fr icon}}</ref>
In the summer of 2010 [[Scottish Premier League]] club [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] attempted to sign Wanyama but Beerschot did not allow him to leave. Russian club [[CSKA Moscow]] also attempted to sign him, but they failed as well.<ref>[http://www.footgoal.net/suite.php?selection=57331 Wanyama va rester au Germinal Beerschot (Wanyama stays with Germinal Beerschot)] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100819044505/http://www.footgoal.net/suite.php?selection=57331 |date=19 August 2010 }} Footgoal, 16 April 2010 {{fr icon}}</ref>
Wanyama scored his first goal for Beerschot on 11 December 2010, a 77th-minute equaliser against Westerlo. In April 2011, he received another three match suspension after video evidence showed he had elbowed Brecht Dejaeghere of [[K.V. Kortrijk]].<ref>[http://www.footgoal.net/suite.php?selection=67175 Wanyama poursuivi (Wanyama continued)] {{webarchive|url=https://www.webcitation.org/6AV6iiuF7?url=http://www.footgoal.net/suite.php?selection=67175 |date=7 September 2012 }} Footgoal, 18 April 2011 {{fr icon}}</ref>
=== Celtic === [[File:Victor Wanyama 2012.jpg|thumb|right|upright|Wanyama playing for [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] in 2012]]
On 9 July 2011, Wanyama finally completed a £900,000 move to Celtic, after the Scottish club had failed to sign him the previous year.<ref name="Celtic">{{cite news |url = http://www.celticfc.net/newsstory?item=1253 |title = Wanyama is a Celt |publisher = Celtic FC |date = 9 July 2011 |accessdate = 9 July 2011 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20110817004244/http://www.celticfc.net/newsstory?item=1253 |archivedate = 17 August 2011 |df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Victor Wanyama wins work permit appeal to sign for Celtic |url=http://www.scotzine.com/2011/07/victor-wanyama-wins-work-permit-appeal-to-sign-for-celtic/ |publisher=Scotzine.com |date=8 July 2011 | accessdate=24 January 2013 }}</ref> He signed a four-year contract and in doing so became the first ever Kenyan to play in the SPL. Wanyama chose 67 as his squad number to honour the [[Lisbon Lions]], Celtic's [[1967 European Cup Final|1967 European Cup]]-winning team.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.eveningtimes.co.uk/sport/editor-s-picks/stipe-pletikosa-and-victor-wanyama-set-to-make-celtic-bow-1.1113107 | title = Stipe Pletikosa and Victor Wanyama set to make Celtic bow | publisher = Herald & Times Group | work = Evening Times | date = 20 July 2011 | accessdate = 23 September 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14082372 | title = Germinal's Victor Wanyama completes switch to Celtic | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 9 July 2011 | accessdate = 25 June 2012}}</ref> Wanyama made his Celtic league debut in a 1–0 loss to [[St Johnstone F.C.|St Johnstone]] on 21 August 2011. He played in central defence rather than his favoured central midfield role.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.heraldscotland.com/sport/spl/celtic/when-they-scored-the-fans-wanted-more-and-we-couldn-t-handle-it-1.1119214 | title = 'When they scored the fans wanted more and we couldn't handle it’ | publisher = Herald & Times Group | work = Herald Scotland | date = 23 August 2011 | accessdate = 30 August 2011}}</ref> He came on as a late substitute in a 4–0 win over [[Motherwell F.C.|Motherwell]],<ref>{{cite news | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14773073.stm | title = Celtic 4–0 Motherwell | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 10 September 2011 | accessdate = 23 September 2011}}</ref> and played for the whole second half in a 2–0 [[Scottish League Cup|League Cup]] win over [[Ross County F.C.|Ross County]].<ref>{{cite news | url = http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/21092011/63/ross-county-v-celtic-21-september.html | title = Ross County v Celtic – 21 September | publisher = Yahoo! Sport | work = Eurosport | date = 21 September 2011 | accessdate = 23 September 2011}}</ref> On 29 September 2011, he started in Celtic's 1–1 draw with Italian team [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] in the [[Europa League]]. This was his first European match for the club.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15014638.stm | title = Celtic 1–1 Udinese | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 29 September 2011 | accessdate = 29 September 2011}}</ref> On 10 December 2011, Wanyama scored his first goal for Celtic in a 1–0 win over [[Heart of Midlothian F.C.|Hearts]] at [[Celtic Park]], a tremendous 25-yard strike which hit the top corner.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16015615.stm | title = Celtic 1–0 Hearts | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 10 December 2011 | accessdate = 12 December 2011}}</ref> His performances during December earned him the [[Scottish Premier League monthly awards|Scottish Premier League young player of the month]] award.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://sport.stv.tv/football/scottish-premier/celtic/293525-celtics-victor-wanyama-named-spl-young-player-of-the-month/ | title = Celtic's Victor Wanyama named SPL Young Player of the Month | publisher = STV Sport | date = 13 January 2012 | accessdate = 8 February 2012}}</ref> He scored his second Celtic goal on 2 January 2012 in a 3–0 win against Dunfermline at [[East End Park]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16331432.stm|title=Dunfermline 0 – 3 Celtic|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 January 2011|accessdate=3 January 2011}}</ref> Wanyama scored in Celtic's 2–1 win against [[Dundee United F.C.|Dundee United]] at [[Celtic Park]]<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/jan/14/hearts-hibs-celtic-aberdeen-spl|title=Celtic's Gary Hooper and Victor Wanyama strike to sink Dundee United|last=Briggs|first=Nial|work=The Guardian|date=14 January 2012}}</ref> and in the 4–0 victory against [[Hearts F.C.|Hearts]] at [[Tynecastle Stadium|Tynecastle]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/celtic/9069307/Hearts-0-Celtic-4-match-report.html|title=Hearts 0 Celtic 4: match report|last=Forsyth|first=Roddy|work=The Daily Telegraph|date=8 February 2012}}</ref>
On 20 October 2012, Wanyama scored twice against [[St Mirren F.C.|St Mirren]] at [[St Mirren Park]], the second of which was a half volley from 25 yards out.<ref>{{cite news |title=Clinical Celtic warmed up for the Nou Camp with what turned out to be little more than a training exercise as they outclassed a feeble St Mirren |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19939572 |work=BBC Sport |publisher=British Broadcasting Corporation |date=20 October 2012 |accessdate=24 January 2013 }}</ref> On 25 October, Wanyama's agent released a statement saying that he had turned down an improved contract offer from [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]], stating that his wage demands could not be met by the club amid speculation of interest from clubs in England.<ref>{{cite news |title=Scottish Football – Wanyama rejects Celtic deal |url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/news/scottish-football-wanyama-rejects-celtic-deal-185103875.html |work=Eurosport |publisher=[[Yahoo!]] |date=25 October 2012 |accessdate=26 October 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130128003423/http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/news/scottish-football-wanyama-rejects-celtic-deal-185103875.html |archivedate=28 January 2013 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> On 7 November, Wanyama opened the scoring with a powerful header as [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] shocked [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] group stage, by beating them 2–1 at [[Celtic Park]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/news/newsid=1855396.html |title=Debutant Watt lights up memorable Celtic victory |work=UEFA |date=25 October 2012 |accessdate=20 September 2014 }}</ref>
=== Southampton === [[File:Victor Wanyama 2014.jpg|thumb|right|Wanyama with [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in 2014]]
After much speculation and a previous breakdown in talks, on 11 July 2013, Wanyama signed for [[Premier League]] side [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] for a fee claimed to be £12.5 million,<ref>{{cite web | title= Victor Wanyama: Southampton sign Celtic midfielder for £12.5m | url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22969633| publisher=BBC Sport| date=11 July 2013 | accessdate= 11 July 2013}}</ref> making him the first Kenyan to ever play in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite web | title=Wanyama makes Saints switch | url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/wanyama-makes-saints-switch-909448.aspx | publisher=Southampton FC | date= 11 July 2013| accessdate= 11 July 2013}}</ref>
Wanyama said: {{centred pull quote|Southampton is a good club and it has good players, so I just want to train hard and work hard to be a part of the starting XI. We'll see where that will take me. It feels great and I am happy to be here. There were other options, but Southampton is a club with ambitions so I chose to come here. I'm very grateful to be here and I'm looking forward to playing in the Premier League.}}
He made his debut on 17 August 2013, in 1–0 away win against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite web|title=West Brom 0–1 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23644676 |publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=19 August 2013|date=17 August 2013}}</ref> Wanyama made 24 appearances in his first season, but injuries hindered his efforts to make much of an impact in the team.<ref>{{cite web|title=Victor Wanyama desperate for Saints to end with record breaking tally|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/sport/11160909.Victor_Wanyama_desperate_for_Saints_to_end_with_record_breaking_tally/|publisher=Daily Echo|accessdate=2 November 2014|date=21 April 2014}}</ref>
Under new manager [[Ronald Koeman]], Wanyama came into his own in the 2014–15 season.<ref name="f411">{{cite web|title=Wanyama considered switch|url=http://www.football411.com/story/0,22162,14287_16580,00.html|publisher=Football 411|accessdate=2 November 2014|format=24 October 2014}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club in a 1–0 [[2014–15 Premier League|league]] victory over [[Swansea City F.C.|Swansea City]] at the [[Liberty Stadium]] on 20 September 2014, after replacing [[James Ward-Prowse]] in the 69th minute.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29187272 |title=Swansea 0–1 Southampton|publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 September 2014 |accessdate=20 September 2014 }}</ref> His next goal came in an 8–0 trouncing of [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] on 19 October 2014.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Reddy |first1=Luke |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29580147 |title=Southampton 8 – 0 Sunderland |work=BBC Sport |date=18 October 2014 |accessdate=18 October 2014}}</ref> Wanyama would score his third goal for the Saints in spectacular fashion, a 40-yard shot after [[Eldin Jakupović]]'s poor clearance fell straight to him, in what proved to be the only goal in a win over [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Keegan |first1=Mike |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29768014 |title=Hull City 0 – 1 Southampton |work=BBC Sport |date=1 November 2014 |accessdate=1 November 2014}}</ref> His performances saw him awarded the league's African Player of the Month for September,<ref name="f411" /> with him stating "It is wonderful being recognised as someone who has done well for his club."<ref name="f411" />
=== Tottenham Hotspur === [[File:Manchester United v Tottenham Hotspur, December 2016 (08).JPG|thumb|right|Wanyama ''(left)'' alongside Spurs clubmates in a league clash with [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in 2016]] On 23 June 2016, Premier League club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] announced that they had reached an agreement with Southampton for the transfer of Wanyama,<ref>{{cite web|title=Wanyama transfer completed |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/victor-wanyama-transfer-completed-230616/ |publisher=tottenhamhotspur.com |date=23 June 2016 |accessdate=23 June 2016}}</ref> signing a five-year contract for a fee of £11 million.<ref>{{cite web|title=Victor Wanyama: Tottenham sign Southampton midfielder on five-year deal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36612577 |publisher=bbc.co.uk |date=23 June 2016 |accessdate=23 June 2016}}</ref> Wanyama had previously worked with Tottenham manager [[Mauricio Pochettino]] who brought him to Southampton in July 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title=Tottenham sign Victor Wanyama from Southampton |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/06/23/tottenham-sign-victor-wanyama-from-southampton/ |publisher=telegraph.co.uk |date=23 June 2016 |accessdate=23 June 2016}}</ref> Wanyama scored his first goal for the club on his home debut against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], in the 82nd minute of a 1–0 league win for Spurs.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foxsports.com.au/football/premier-league/tottenham-v-crystal-palace-victor-wanyama-seals-spurs-first-premier-league-win-for-20162017/news-story/107b8ea4be58f68e4437dd34b9a85b6d |title=Tottenham v Crystal Palace: Victor Wanyama seals Spurs’ first Premier League win for 2016–2017 |date=21 August 2016 |work=[[Fox Sports (Australia)|Fox Sports Australia]] |accessdate=21 August 2016}}</ref> The goal made him the 138th different player to score for the club, extending its record for the most variety of goalscorers for a single club in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/78854 |title=Wanyama extends Spurs benchmark |date=23 August 2016 |publisher=[[Premier League|The Premier League]] |accessdate=28 August 2016}}</ref>
Early in the [[2017–18 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2017–18]] season, Wanyama injured his knee in the match against Chelsea and was sidelined for over four months.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en-ke/news/victor-wanyama-hands-tottenham-hotspur-injury-boost/16wcxeabv2wl71j2bnaedvdlo3 |title= Victor Wanyama hands Tottenham Hotspur injury boost |first=Taiye |last= Taiwo |date=7 December 2017 |work= Goal.com|accessdate=19 December 2017 }}</ref> He returned to training in mid-December.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Prosser|first1=Jack|title=Tottenham midfielder Victor Wanyama returns to first team training|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/tottenham-midfielder-victor-wanyama-returns-to-first-team-training-a3716976.html|accessdate=19 December 2017|work=Evening Standard|date=11 December 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Thomas|first1=Lyall|title=Victor Wanyama returns to Tottenham training as he steps up recovery from knee injury|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11675/11166861/victor-wanyama-returns-to-tottenham-training-as-he-steps-up-recovery-from-knee-injury|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=19 December 2017|date=11 December 2017}}</ref> On 2 January 2018, he made his first appearance after his injury, as a substitute in the away match against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.si.com/soccer/2018/01/02/swansea-city-0-2-tottenham-hotspur-spurs-grind-out-win-dreadful-weather-conditions |title=Tottenham Grinds Out Win Over Swansea in Rainy Conditions |date=2 January 2018 |work=Sports Illustrated|accessdate=2 January 2018 }}</ref>
Wanyama picked up a knee injury in a pre-season game of the [[2018–19 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2018–19 season]] against Barcelona.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://cartilagefreecaptain.sbnation.com/2018/7/26/17619850/tottenham-hotspur-news-victor-wanyama-usa-tour-injury-premier-league |title=Victor Wanyama picks up knee injury on preseason | }}</ref> He made his first start of the season two months later in the [[2018–19 EFL Cup|Carabao Cup]] game against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] that Spurs won on penalties.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.futaa.com/article/164907/full-hour-for-wanyama-as-spurs-edge-out-watford|title=Full hour for Wanyama as Spurs edge out Watford |first= Jeff |last= Kinyanjui|date= 27 September 2018 |work=Futaa}}</ref>
== International career == Wanyama made his debut for the [[Kenya national football team|Kenyan national team]] in May 2007, aged just 15 in a friendly against [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]].<ref name=Cement/> He also played in all six of Kenya's [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] [[2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (CAF)|qualifiers]]. He became the [[Captain (association football)|captain]] of his national team in 2013.

'''Individual''' *[[Scottish Premier League Yearly Awards|SPL Young Player of the Year]]: [[2012–13 in Scottish football|2012–13]] *[[Scottish Premier League monthly awards|SPL Young Player of the Month]]: [[2011-12 in Scottish football|December 2011]]
== Personal life == Wanyama comes from a sporting family. His brother [[McDonald Mariga]] is also a professional footballer,<ref>[http://www.futaa.com/football/article/mariga-confirmed-at-parma Mariga confirmed at Parma] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120304195947/http://www.futaa.com/football/article/mariga-confirmed-at-parma |date=4 March 2012 }} Futaa.com, 31 January 2012</ref><ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17705309 Kenya's McDonald Mariga faces lengthy spell out] BBC Sport, 13 April 2012</ref> while his other brothers [[Thomas Wanyama|Thomas]] and Sylvester Wanyama are also footballers in the [[Kenyan Premier League]]. His father, Noah Wanyama, was a footballer for [[A.F.C. Leopards]] in the 1980s,<ref>[http://www.futaa.com/football/article/Noah-Wanyama-hits-the-campaign-trail Noah Wanyama hits the campaign trail] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130704232701/http://www.futaa.com/football/article/noah-wanyama-hits-the-campaign-trail |date=4 July 2013 }} Futaa.com, 18 October 2011</ref> and his sister Mercy is a professional basketball player in the USA.<ref>[http://www.michezoafrika.com/basketball/mercy-wanyama-secures-kshs.20million-scholarship-package/2550.aspx Mercy Wanyama secures Kshs.20Million scholarship package] MichezoAfrika, 6 August 2011</ref>
Wanyama is managed by [[Rob Moore (South African Entrepreneur)|ExtraTime]],<ref name=ETVic>[http://www.extratime.es/clients/14/victor-wanyama Victor Wanyama] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120701110123/http://www.extratime.es/clients/14/victor-wanyama |date=1 July 2012 }} ExtraTime</ref> and has a boot sponsorship deal with Adidas.
In 2015, Wanyama participated in the production of a short film about football in Kenya called ''Mdudu Boy'', written and directed by actress [[Ella Smith (actress)|Ella Smith]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ellis|first1=Dawn|title=Film being made by Westcountry actor has celebrity support|url=http://www.westernmorningnews.co.uk/Film-Westcountry-actor-celebrity-support/story-26821040-detail/story.html|accessdate=5 March 2016|publisher=Western Morning News|date=2 July 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150803092543/http://www.westernmorningnews.co.uk/Film-Westcountry-actor-celebrity-support/story-26821040-detail/story.html|archive-date=3 August 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>

'''Michel Armand Vorm''' ({{IPA-nl|ˈmiʃɛl ˈvɔrm}}; born 20 October 1983) is a [[Netherlands|Dutch]] footballer who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for English club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands national team]].
Vorm began his professional career at [[FC Utrecht]] in 2005, spending his first season on loan at [[FC Den Bosch]]. He transferred to [[Swansea City]] in 2011, playing three [[Premier League]] seasons and winning the [[2013 Football League Cup Final|League Cup in 2013]]. Vorm joined Tottenham for £3.5 million in 2014.
A full international for the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] since 2009, Vorm was included in their squads for two World Cups and [[Euro 2012]], as back-up in all three tournaments.
==Club career==
===FC Utrecht=== Born in [[IJsselstein]] to a Dutch mother and a [[Suriname]]se father,<ref>{{Cite web|url = https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/swansea-city/10422121/I-love-this-type-of-game-no-matter-how-intense-it-is-says-Swanseas-Michel-Vorm-ahead-of-derby-against-Cardiff.html|title = 'I love this type of game, no matter how intense it is,' says Swansea's Michel Vorm ahead of derby against Cardiff|website = The Daily Telegraph|access-date = 6 March 2016}}</ref> Vorm began his career at [[FC Utrecht]]. In order to gain more experience, he spent the 2005–06 season on loan to [[FC Den Bosch]]. He made his debut on 12 August 2005 against [[FC Emmen]], the first of 35 appearances that season.
In August 2006, Vorm made his debut for Utrecht against [[Willem II (football club)|Willem II]]. Although he joined FC Utrecht as the third-choice goalkeeper, behind [[Franck Grandel]] and [[Joost Terol]], his pre-season performances impressed manager [[Foeke Booy]], and saw him promoted to first choice 'keeper at the start of the league season. During this first season Vorm played 33 out of 34 matches, and his position as number one at the club remained unchallenged thereafter. Vorm missed a handful matches during the 2007–08 season due to knee and shoulder injuries. He left Utrecht at the start of the 2011–12 season, having played 136 matches in the [[Eredivisie]].
===Swansea City=== In August 2011, Vorm joined [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] for a fee of around £1.5 million.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/aug/07/swansea-michel-vorm-utrecht|title=Swansea agree fee for Dutch international goalkeeper Michel Vorm|date=7 August 2011|work=The Guardian|accessdate=23 August 2011|location=London}}</ref> He took the vacant number 1 shirt and made his debut for the club against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 15 August 2011 in a 4–0 defeat.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/report?gameId=318034|title=Manchester City vs. Swansea City – Football Match Report – August 15, 2011 |publisher=ESPN}}</ref> Although he conceded four goals, he also made eleven saves – more than any other Premier League goalkeeper, in a single match, in the whole of the 2011–12 season. In his second match for Swansea against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]], on 20 August, Vorm saved a 72nd-minute penalty from [[Ben Watson (footballer born July 1985)|Ben Watson]], to give Swansea their first ever point in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14514711.stm | publisher=BBC News | title=Swansea 0–0 Wigan | date=20 August 2011}}</ref> On 6 November 2011, Vorm arguably saved Swansea from defeat against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and earned them the draw at [[Anfield]] by pulling off two outstanding saves to earn the [[clean sheet]]. On 10 December, he was instrumental in Swansea's 2–0 win over [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] as he saved [[Clint Dempsey]]'s 87th-minute penalty, with Swansea 1–0 up.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16015563 | title = Swansea 2–0 Fulham | date = 10 December 2011| accessdate = 10 December 2011 | publisher = BBC Sport}}</ref>
During his first season with Swansea he helped keep 13 clean sheets in 37 league appearances.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.11kicks.com/Teams/Swansea_City_1/Stats |title=Archived copy |accessdate=24 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120323153459/http://www.11kicks.com/Teams/Swansea_City_1/Stats |archivedate=23 March 2012 |df= }}</ref> His performances were so impressive that he won three awards at the club's end-of-season dinner – Supporters' Player of the Year, Players' Player and the Away Player awards.<ref>{{cite news|title=Vorm's triple trophy swoop|url=http://www.swanseacity.com/news/article/awards-night-207835.aspx|publisher=[[Swansea City A.F.C.]]|date=10 May 2012}}{{Dead link|date=September 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
On 27 September 2012, Vorm signed a new four-year contract with Swansea.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19658904|title=Goalkeeper Michel Vorm signs new Swansea City contract|date=27 September 2012|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 28 October 2012, he was ruled out for up to eight weeks due to a groin injury picked up in a match against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20113017|title=Swansea City suffer goalkeeper Michel Vorm injury blow|date=28 October 2012|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 3 November 2013, in the [[South Wales derby]] against Cardiff City, Vorm was shown a straight red card by referee [[Mike Dean (referee)|Mike Dean]] for a stoppage-time foul on [[Fraizer Campbell]]. The match ended 1–0 to Cardiff City.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Cardiff 1–0 Swansea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24690406|accessdate=6 July 2014|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=3 November 2013}}</ref>
===Tottenham Hotspur===
On 23 July 2014, Vorm announced via Dutch radio that he would sign for [[Tottenham Hotspur]] to compete with [[Hugo Lloris]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/69/transfer-zone/2014/07/23/4977923/vorm-confirms-tottenham-switch?ICID=HP_BN_11|title=Vorm Confirms Tottenham Switch|date=23 July 2014|work=Goal.com}}</ref> He signed on a four-year deal costing Spurs £3.5 million after three years at Swansea, joining on the same day as Swansea's [[Ben Davies (footballer, born 1993)|Ben Davies]] made the same move and [[Gylfi Sigurðsson]] was exchanged as part of the deal.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2703258/Ben-Davies-Michel-Vorm-sign-Tottenham-Swansea-Gylfi-Sigurdsson-heads-Wales-deal.html|title=Ben Davies and Michel Vorm join Spurs from Swansea as Gylfi Sigurdsson heads to Wales as part of deal}}</ref> The transfer was disputed by Utrecht, who complained to FIFA that they were contractually due 30% of the fee received by Swansea.<ref>{{cite news|title=Swansea City: Utrecht report club to Fifa over Vorm fee|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28701743|accessdate=11 August 2014|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=11 August 2014}}</ref> FIFA rejected Utrecht's claim, and the case was heard in the [[Court of Arbitration for Sport]] in January 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=Michel Vorm: Swansea due in court over Tottenham transfer|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35438556|accessdate=29 January 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 January 2016}}</ref>
He made his debut for Tottenham on 24 September, in the third round of the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] at home against [[Nottingham Forest]]. Despite conceding first to [[Jorge Grant]], Tottenham won 3–1.<ref>{{cite news|title=Tottenham 3–1 Nottm Forest|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29233056|accessdate=6 November 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 September 2014}}</ref> Vorm featured again in the next round on 29 October, keeping his first clean sheet for the club as Tottenham defeated [[Brighton & Hove Albion]] 2–0.<ref>{{cite news|title=Tottenham 2–0 Brighton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29718447|accessdate=6 November 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 October 2014}}</ref> Eight days later he played his first [[UEFA Europa League]] match for Tottenham, a 2–1 win away to [[Asteras Tripoli]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Abraham|first1=Timothy|title=Asteras Tripolis 1–2 Tottenham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29919621|accessdate=6 November 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=6 November 2014}}</ref>
Vorm's first league appearance for Tottenham came on 21 March 2015, after Lloris went off injured in the fourth minute of a home match against [[Leicester City]]. Tottenham won 4–3.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Sanghera|first1=Mandeep|title=Tottenham 4–3 Leicester|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31883462|accessdate=22 March 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 March 2015}}</ref> On 5 April he made his first league start, a goalless draw against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] at [[Turf Moor]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Oliver|first1=Pete|title=Burnley 0–0 Tottenham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32103945|accessdate=6 April 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=5 April 2015}}</ref> On 13 August 2016, Vorm made his first appearance of the 2016–17 season for Tottenham Hotspur in a 1–1 draw with Everton at Goodison Park, in which he replaced the injured Lloris after 35 minutes.
==International career== In 2006, he was a member of the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] squad that won the [[UEFA U-21 Championship 2006]] in Portugal.
Vorm played his first match for the senior national team on 14 November 2008, replacing [[Henk Timmer (footballer)|Henk Timmer]] at half time in a 3–1 home friendly win, conceding to [[Kim Källström]] within four minutes of coming on. He made his first start on 5 September 2009 in a friendly home match against [[Japan national football team|Japan]] (3–0 win), followed up four days later by an impressive performance at [[Hampden Park]] during the [[FIFA World Cup qualification|World Cup qualifier]] [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] – Netherlands, a match won 1–0 by the Netherlands.<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/sep/09/world-cup-scotland-holland] – Holland end luckless Scotland's World Cup hopes – 9 September 2009</ref><ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/internationals/8240464.stm] – BBC Sports Scotland 0–1 Netherlands  – 9 September 2009</ref> At Hampden Park, this was Vorm's first competitive match ever outside the Netherlands.<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/sep/08/scotland-holland-maarten-stekelenburg-goalkeeper] – Novice Dutch goalkeeper offers Scots glimmer of hope – 8 September 2009</ref>
===2010 World Cup=== Vorm was included in the preliminary squad for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] in South Africa.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5iO9bETRJh0iovmmUN7ZeFDugTEIg |title=Van Marwijk trims Dutch squad to 27 | agency=Agence France-Presse|date=15 May 2010 |accessdate=18 May 2010 }}</ref> On 27 May 2010, Netherlands manager [[Bert van Marwijk]] announced that the player would be part of the final squad of 23 participating in the FIFA World Cup.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/may/27/holland-world-cup-23-man-squad |title=Holland coach Bert van Marwijk finalises World Cup squad |work=The Guardian |date=27 May 2010 |agency=Press Association |accessdate=27 May 2010 |location=London}}</ref> Before the start of the competition he was allowed to fly back to the Netherlands. During the World Cup, Vorm's girlfriend Daisy delivered a son, Jaivy Waylon. The Dutch goalkeeper returned home for two days following his son's birth.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ad.nl/ad/nl/1049/Oranje/article/detail/490374/2010/06/14/Zoontje-voor-doelman-Vorm-Jaivy-Waylon.dhtml |title=Zoontje voor doelman Vorm: Jaivy Waylon |work=Algemeen Dagblad|date=14 June 2010 |accessdate=7 July 2010| language =Dutch}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rtl.nl/%28/actueel/rtlboulevard/nieuws/articleview/%29/components/actueel/rtlboulevard/2010/06_juni/entertainment/Op_babybezoek_bij_michel_vorm.xml |title=Op babybezoek bij Oranje-keeper Michel Vorm |publisher=RTL.nl| date=16 June 2010 |accessdate=7 July 2010| language=Dutch}}</ref>
===Euro 2012=== Vorm was included in the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] squad for [[Euro 2012]]. [[Maarten Stekelenburg]] was [[Bert van Marwijk]]'s first choice in goal, playing all three games as the nation exited in the group stage.
===2014 World Cup=== For the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], coach [[Louis van Gaal]] included Vorm in the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] squad, alongside young Ajax goalkeeper [[Jasper Cillessen]] who was first choice in goal and [[Tim Krul]]. Despite his{{clarify|date=January 2019}} penalty-saving ability, Van Gaal opted to replace Cillessen with Krul in the [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]] during the quarter-final match against [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]]. Vorm came on for Cillessen in injury time of the 3–0 third place play-off win against [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] in [[Brasília]], thus ensuring that all 23 Dutch squad members played at the tournament.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28173517|title=Brazil 0–3 Netherlands|date=12 July 2014|accessdate=13 July 2014|publisher=BBC}}</ref>
==Career statistics==

VORM|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/michel-vorm/2476/|website=Soccerway|accessdate=11 September 2015}}</ref>
