{{pp-vandalism|small=yes}} {{Distinguish|Bamidele Ali}} {{Use British English|date=March 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Dele Alli | image = Dele Alli 2018 (cropped).jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Alli warming up for [[England national football team|England]] in 2018 | fullname = Bamidele Jermaine Alli<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/810083 |title=2018/19 Premier League squad numbers |publisher=Premier League |date=4 September 2018 |accessdate=29 September 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1996|4|11|df=y}}<ref name=fifawc>{{cite web |url=https://tournament.fifadata.com/documents/FWC/2018/pdf/FWC_2018_SQUADLISTS.PDF |title=FIFA World Cup Russia 2018: List of players: England |publisher=FIFA |format=PDF |page=10 |date=15 July 2018 |accessdate=29 September 2018}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Milton Keynes]], England | height = {{convert|1.88|m|order=flip}}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/bamidele-ali/217739/ |title=D. Alli: Summary |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=22 March 2019}}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | clubnumber = 20 | youthyears1 = {{0|0000}}–2007 | youthclubs1 = City Colts<ref name="BBC Sport 19Sep2014"/> | youthyears2 = 2007–2011 | youthclubs2 = [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] | years1 = 2011–2015 | clubs1 = [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] | caps1 = 62 | goals1 = 18 | years2 = 2015– | clubs2 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | caps2 = 124 | goals2 = 42 | years3 = 2015 | clubs3 = → [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] (loan) | caps3 = 12 | goals3 = 4 | nationalyears1 = 2012–2013 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 9 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2014 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps2 = 2 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2014 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 4 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2015 | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps4 = 2 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalyears5 = 2015– | nationalteam5 = [[England national football team|England]] | nationalcaps5 = 34 | nationalgoals5 = 3 | club-update = 00:11, 23 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 00:11, 23 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Bamidele Jermaine Alli''' (born 11 April 1996) ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|d|ɛ|l|i|_|ˈ|æ|l|i}} {{respell|DEL|ee|_|AL|ee}};<ref>{{Citation |last=FATV |title=FATV Exclusive: Dele Alli Q & A with fans {{!}} #ask...|date=20 June 2016|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8jOi_9N6NoE&t=5s |accessdate=18 November 2017}}</ref>) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for {{English football updater|TottenhH}} club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and the [[England national football team|England national team]].
Born and raised in [[Milton Keynes]], he joined the youth system at [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] aged 11 and broke into the first team five years later, during the [[2012–13 Milton Keynes Dons F.C. season|2012–13 season]]. Over the next two-and-a-half years he made 88 official appearances for the team, scoring 24 goals. He signed for Tottenham Hotspur in February 2015 for an initial fee of £5 million, being loaned back to the Dons for the remainder of the season. In each of his first two campaigns at [[White Hart Lane]], Alli was voted the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] and made the [[PFA Team of the Year]].
Alli played for the England [[England national under-17 football team|U17]], [[England national under-18 football team|U18]] and [[England national under-19 football team|U19]] teams, before making his senior debut in 2015. He was selected for [[UEFA Euro 2016]] and the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], helping England to the semi-finals of the latter.
==Club career== ===Milton Keynes Dons=== ====Early career==== Alli joined the youth system at [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] when he was 11 years old.<ref name="BBC Sport 19Sep2014">{{cite web |author=Osborne, Chris |title=MK Dons' Dele Alli has the makings of next Steven Gerrard |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29251977 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=25 November 2014 |date=19 September 2014}}</ref> He made his debut for the first team as a sixteen-year-old on 2 November 2012, coming on as a 64th-minute substitute for [[Jay O'Shea]] in a 0–0 draw with [[Southern Football League]] club [[Cambridge City F.C.|Cambridge City]] in the [[FA Cup]] first round at Milton Road.<ref name="Cambridge City 0-0 MK Dons">{{Cite news |first=Chris |last=Osborne |title=Cambridge City 0–0 MK Dons |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20091781 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 November 2012 |accessdate=27 February 2013}}</ref> His first touch in professional football was a back-heeled pass.<ref name="BBC Sport 19Sep2014"/> His first goal came in the replay against Cambridge eleven days later, where he scored in a 6–1 win at [[Stadium mk]] on his first start.<ref name="MK Dons 6-1 Cambridge City">{{Cite news |title=MK Dons 6–1 Cambridge City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20216720 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 November 2012 |accessdate=27 February 2013}}</ref> He made his league debut in the 2–3 defeat to [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] at home on 29 December, where he played 71 minutes before being replaced by [[Zeli Ismail]].<ref name="MK Dons 2-3 Coventry City">{{Cite news |title=MK Dons 2 – 3 Coventry City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20823148 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 December 2012 |accessdate=26 June 2014}}</ref> His only other league appearance in the [[2012–13 Football League One]] season, came as a second-half substitute for [[Patrick Bamford]] in the last match of the season, a 2–0 win over [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] at [[Broadhall Way]].<ref name="Stevenage 0-2 MK Dons">{{Cite news |title=Stevenage 0 –2 MK Dons |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22228842 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 April 2013 |accessdate=26 June 2014}}</ref>
====2013–14 season==== The 2013–14 season saw Alli break into the MK Dons first team on a regular basis. He started the Dons' first league match of the season, a 0–0 draw away at [[Shrewsbury Town F.C.|Shrewsbury Town]].<ref name="Shrewsbury Town 0-0 MK Dons">{{Cite news |title=Shrewsbury Town 0–0 MK Dons |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23474989 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 August 2013 |accessdate=26 June 2014}}</ref> In his first [[Football League Trophy]] appearance, Alli scored to help MK Dons beat [[Northampton Town F.C.|Northampton Town]] 2–0 and thus progress to the second round of the tournament.<ref name="MK Dons 2-0 Northampton Town">{{Cite news |title=MK Dons 2–0 Northampton Town |url=http://www.mkweb.co.uk/Sport/Football/MK-Dons/2013-2014/Match-Reports/Football-Match-report-MK-Dons-2-0-Northampton-Town-20130903214442.htm |publisher=MK Web |date=3 September 2013 |accessdate=26 June 2014 }}{{Dead link|date=February 2019 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> On 28 September, Alli scored his first professional league goal in the 4–1 thrashing of Stevenage.<ref name="MK Dons 4-1 Stevenage F.C.">{{Cite news |title=MK Dons 4 – 1 Stevenage F.C. |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24184935 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 September 2013 |accessdate=26 June 2014}}</ref> After being in and out of the first team picture in late 2013 due to injury setbacks, Alli would go on and establish himself as a first-choice player in 2014. He scored the opening goal in the 3–2 win over Shrewsbury Town at Stadium mk on 11 January, with a header from [[Stephen Gleeson]]'s pinpoint pass.<ref name="MK Dons 3-2 Shrewsbury Town">{{Cite news |title=MK Dons 3 – 2 Shrewsbury Town |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25599633 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 January 2014 |accessdate=26 June 2014}}</ref> On 11 March, against [[Notts County F.C.|Notts County]] at [[Meadow Lane]], aged 17 years and 11 months old, Alli scored a hat-trick to guide the 'Dons to a 3–1 victory.<ref name="Notts County 1-3 MK Dons">{{Cite news |title=Notts County 1 – 3 MK Dons |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26428670 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 March 2014 |accessdate=26 June 2014}}</ref> His next and final goal of the 2013–14 season, came on 5 April against Coventry City at the [[Sixfields Stadium]]; Alli struck a thunderous volley from 25 yards out as MK Dons defeated Coventry, 2–1.<ref name="Coventry City 1-2 MK Dons">{{Cite news |title=Coventry City 1 – 2 MK Dons |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26796275 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 April 2014 |accessdate=26 June 2014}}</ref> He made 37 appearances in all competitions during the 2013–14 season, scoring 7 times, with 33 appearances and 6 goals in the league.
====2014–15 season==== [[File:MK Dons Vs Barnsley (16176325970, cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Alli playing for [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] in 2015]]
With the departure of Gleeson to [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] in June 2014,<ref>{{cite news |title=Stephen Gleeson: Birmingham City sign MK Dons midfielder |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/27766227 |accessdate=8 September 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 June 2014}}</ref> Alli became the first-choice central midfield partner to [[Darren Potter]]. He started the season brightly, playing the first league match of the season as the Dons overcame a 2–0 deficit to defeat Gillingham, 4–2.<ref>{{cite news |title=Milton Keynes Dons 4–2 Gillingham |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/28646630 |accessdate=8 September 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2014}}</ref> He then helped the team to a 3–1 win over arch-enemies, [[AFC Wimbledon]], in the League Cup first round.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Osborne |first1=Chris |title=Milton Keynes Dons 3–1 AFC Wimbledon |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/28652624 |accessdate=8 September 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 August 2014}}</ref> His first goal of the 2014–15 season came in the first away league match, a 3–2 defeat to [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough United]], where he scored a tap-in from [[Will Grigg]]'s deflected shot.<ref>{{cite news |title=Peterborough United 3–2 MK Dons |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/28716648 |accessdate=8 September 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2014}}</ref>
On 26 August, Alli played the full 90 minutes in the [[2014–15 Football League Cup|League Cup]] second round as MK Dons recorded a historic 4–0 win over [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Osborne |first1=Chris |title=Milton Keynes Dons 4–0 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/28847955 |accessdate=8 September 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 August 2014}}</ref> It was reported that numerous scouts from top clubs across Europe attended the match to watch him play, including representatives from [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] and [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref name="BBC Sport 19Sep2014"/><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/mk-dons/11055337/MK-Dons-chairman-Pete-Winkelman-relishing-Capital-One-Cup-tie-with-Manchester-United.html |title=MK Dons chairman Pete Winkelman relishing Capital One Cup tie with Manchester United |date=25 August 2014 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=3 February 2015}}</ref> In the match after the 4–0 League Cup win over Manchester United, Alli continued his rich vein of form with a goal curled in from the edge of the box in a 2–0 win over [[Crawley Town F.C.|Crawley Town]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Milton Keynes Dons 2–0 Crawley Town |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/28906337 |accessdate=8 September 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 August 2014}}</ref> After the international break, Alli played 77 minutes in the 5–3 win against Barnsley, assisting the Dons second goal and scoring their third goal himself with a chip over the Barnsley goalkeeper.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29090112 |title=Barnsley 3–5 Milton Keynes Dons |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 February 2015}}</ref> He was chosen as the [[Football League Young Player of the Month]] for August.<ref name="BBC Sport 19Sep2014"/>
On 18 September, Alli extended his contract with MK Dons until June 2017.<ref>{{cite web |title=Dele Alli: MK Dons midfielder prospect extends contract |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29251972 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=19 September 2014 |date=18 September 2014}}</ref> Two days later, in a match against [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe Alexandra]], he scored a hat-trick and achieved one assist in what turned out to be a 6–1 victory for the Dons. It was the second hat-trick of his career and the first he achieved at home, which also led to him winning the Man of the Match award.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mkweb.co.uk/Dele-Alli-inspired-MK-Dons-dismantle-Crewe/story-22956274-detail/story.html |title=Match report: MK Dons 6 Crewe Alexandra 1 – Dele Alli inspired Dons dismantle Alex |publisher=MK News |accessdate=3 February 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140924062649/http://www.mkweb.co.uk/Dele-Alli-inspired-MK-Dons-dismantle-Crewe/story-22956274-detail/story.html |archive-date=24 September 2014 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
===Tottenham Hotspur=== On 2 February 2015, Alli signed for [[Premier League]] club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in the last hours of the mid-season transfer window on a five-and-a-half-year deal for an initial fee of £5 million.<ref name=spurstransfer>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31105458 |title=Dele Alli: Tottenham sign £5m MK Dons midfielder & loan him back |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 February 2015}}</ref>
====Milton Keynes Dons (loan)==== Following his transfer to Tottenham Hotspur, Alli was immediately loaned back to MK Dons for the remainder of the 2014–15 season.<ref name=spurstransfer/> On 19 April, he was chosen as the Young Player of the Year at the [[Football League Awards]].<ref name=auto>{{cite news |title=Kevin Phillips: Ex-England striker wins Football League award |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32364490 |accessdate=20 April 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 April 2015}}</ref> The season ended on 3 May with Milton Keynes Dons promoted automatically to the [[EFL Championship|Championship]] as runners-up behind [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]], after a 5–1 home win over relegated [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]].<ref>{{cite news |title=MK Dons 5–1 Yeovil |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32471126 |accessdate=3 May 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 May 2015}}</ref>
====2015–16 season==== [[File:Alli (cropped) 2.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Alli playing for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in 2016]]
On 8 August 2015, Alli made his Tottenham debut against Manchester United in the Premier League as a substitute in a 1–0 defeat away at [[Old Trafford]], playing the last 13 minutes in place of [[Eric Dier]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Kyler Walker's own goal gives Manchester United the win in season opener |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33744640 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=8 August 2015 |date=8 August 2015}}</ref> Two weeks later, he scored his first goal for the club after coming on for [[Christian Eriksen]] in the 1–1 draw against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/aug/22/leicester-city-tottenham-hotspur-premier-league-match-report |title=Leicester City 1–1 Tottenham Hotspur – Premier League match report |date=22 August 2015 |last=Doyle |first=Paul |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref>
On 13 September, Alli made his first start for Tottenham in a 1–0 win against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] at the [[Stadium of Light]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/dele-looking-forward-150915/ |title=Dele looking forward |date=15 September 2015 |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C.}}</ref> On 2 November, he started and scored the second goal in an eventual 3–1 win over [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Fifield |first=Dominic |title=Tottenham rapidly expose size of Rémi Garde's task at Aston Villa |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/nov/02/tottenham-aston-villa-premier-league-match-report |accessdate=13 November 2015 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=2 November 2015}}</ref> Six days later he started his first [[North London Derby]] alongside fellow England youngster Dier in central midfield, and was awarded Man of the Match in the 1–1 draw between rivals Arsenal and Tottenham.<ref>{{cite news |last=Higginson |first=Marc |title=Arsenal 1–1 Tottenham Hotspur |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34691295 |accessdate=13 November 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 November 2015}}</ref> On 5 December 2015, he scored his third goal for Tottenham in the 2015–16 campaign in a 1–1 draw against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] at [[The Hawthorns]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Winton |first=Richard |title=West Brom 1–1 Tottenham Hotspur |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34951747 |accessdate=5 December 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 December 2015}}</ref>
Following an impressive start to his Premier League career scoring five goals and making three assists in his first 18 league matches, he was rewarded with a new long-term contract until 2021 on 12 January.<ref>{{cite web |title=Dele Alli signs new Tottenham contract until 2021 |url=http://www.espnfc.com/tottenham-hotspur/story/2785100/dele-alli-signs-new-tottenham-contract-until-2021 |website=ESPN FC |accessdate=12 January 2016 |date=12 January 2016}}</ref> Eleven days later he scored a 25-yard volley in a 3–1 win at [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]; [[BBC Sport]] pundit and former Spurs player [[Garth Crooks]] wrote "Well, I've seen some glorious goals scored in my time watching football matches but I doubt whether I will see a goal scored with such individual flair, and by a 19-year-old, as Dele Alli's goal at [[Selhurst Park]] – it was sheer class".<ref>{{cite news |last=Crooks |first=Garth |title=Garth Crooks' team of the week: Alli, Firmino, Payet |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35396058?ns_mchannel=social&ns_campaign=bbc_match_of_the_day&ns_source=facebook&ns_linkname=sport |accessdate=25 January 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 January 2016}}</ref> On 13 April, he was named on the six-man shortlist for 2015–16's [[PFA Young Player of the Year]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/pfa-young-player-year-tottenham-7745910 |title=PFA Young Player of the Year: Tottenham duo Dele Alli and Harry Kane lead the nominations |date=13 April 2016 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London}}</ref>
[[File:Dele Alli 2017 (cropped).jpg|thumb|332x332px|Alli on the final day of the [[2016–17 Premier League|2016–17 Premier League season]], 21 May 2017.]]
On 18 April 2016, he scored his first brace for Tottenham in a 0–4 away win at [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]],<ref>{{cite web |title=Harry Kane, Dele Alli help Tottenham beat Stoke, close gap behind Leicester |url=http://www.espnfc.us/barclays-premier-league/match/422332/stoke-city-tottenham-hotspur/report |website=ESPN FC |accessdate=18 April 2016}}</ref> reaching ten goals in his debut Premier League season.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/stoke-city-vs-tottenham-live-7752644 |title=Stoke City vs Tottenham live score and goal updates from the Britannia Stadium |date=18 April 2016 |newspaper=Daily Record |location=Glasgow}}</ref> He was voted the season's PFA Young Player of the Year.<ref name=PFAYPOTY1516>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36124713 |title=Riyad Mahrez: Leicester City forward named PFA Player of the Year |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 April 2016 |accessdate=6 May 2018}}</ref> On 28 April, Alli was banned by the Football Association for three matches, effectively ending his Premier League season, for an off-the-ball incident against West Bromwich Albion in which he punched midfielder [[Claudio Yacob]] in the stomach. He later apologised for the incident on Twitter, stating, "Gutted that my season is over. Shouldn't have reacted like I did. Will learn from this and come back stronger."<ref>{{cite news |title=Dele Alli banned: Tottenham Hotspur midfielder given three-game ban but will be back for Euro 2016 |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/dele-alli-banned-tottenham-midfielder-given-three-game-ban-but-back-for-euro-2016-a7005651.html |date=28 April 2016 |accessdate=1 May 2016 |newspaper=The Independent |location=London}}</ref>
====2016–17 season==== Ahead of the season, Alli changed his kit name to Dele, saying that he had "no connection" to his legal surname due to his separation from his mother.<ref name=reason>{{cite news |title=Dele Alli reveals personal reason for shirt name change |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11675/10533658/dele-alli-reveals-personal-reason-for-shirt-name-change |accessdate=12 August 2016 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=12 August 2016}}</ref> His first goal of the season came in a 4–0 win against Stoke City on 10 September 2016.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37263919 |title=Stoke City 0–4 Tottenham Hotspur |date=10 September 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Four days later, he made his [[UEFA Champions League]] debut in a 1–2 loss to [[AS Monaco FC|AS Monaco]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37331296 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 1–2 Monaco |date=14 September 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=18 August 2018}}</ref> His first Champions League goal came against [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]] at the same stadium on 7 December 2016.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38226576 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 3–1 CSKA Moscow |date=7 December 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=18 August 2018}}</ref> Between 18 December 2016 and 21 January 2017, Alli scored eight goals in six league matches, earning the award of [[Premier League Player of the Month]] award for January 2017. This included three consecutive braces against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]], [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] and [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/327706 |title=Dele Alli wins EA SPORTS Player of the Month |publisher=Premier League |date=10 February 2017 |accessdate=5 December 2017}}</ref>
On 23 February, Alli received his first red card for a dangerous tackle on [[Brecht Dejaegere]] in Tottenham's [[2016–17 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]] draw with [[K.A.A. Gent]] which saw Spurs eliminated at the [[2016–17 UEFA Europa League knockout phase#Round of 32|Round of 32]] stage of the competition.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.com.au/tottenham-hotspur/story/3067622/dele-alli-very-disappointed-and-sad-for-red-card-in-gent-loss |title=Dele Alli 'very disappointed and sad' for red card in Spurs' loss to Gent |date=24 February 2017 |website=ESPN FC}}</ref> On 20 April 2017, Alli was again named in the [[PFA Team of the Year]],<ref name=PFA1617>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39648483 |title=PFA teams of the year: Chelsea and Tottenham dominate Premier League XI |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 April 2017 |accessdate=6 May 2018}}</ref> having been included in the League One selection for 2015<ref name=PFA1415>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32474398 |title=League One Team of the Year: Five Bristol City players selected |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 April 2015 |accessdate=6 May 2018}}</ref> and the Premier League selection in 2016.<ref name=PFA1516>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36106596 |title=PFA awards: Leicester and Spurs dominate Premier League team |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 April 2016 |accessdate=6 May 2018}}</ref> On 23 April, he was named the PFA Young Player of the Year,<ref name=PFAYPOTY1617>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39686272 |title=PFA Player of the Year: Chelsea's N'Golo Kante wins top award for 2016–17 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 April 2017 |accessdate=6 May 2018}}</ref> the day after scoring in Tottenham's 4–2 [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup]] semi-final loss to rivals Chelsea at Wembley Stadium.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39604653 |title=Chelsea 4–2 Tottenham |date=22 April 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== Alli scored his first goal of the season in the opening game of the [[2017–18 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2017–18 season]] away at Newcastle that finished in a 2–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/aug/13/newcastle-tottenham-premier-league-match-report |title=Newcastle's Jonjo Shelvey sees red as Dele Alli has last laugh for Tottenham |first=Louise |last=Taylor |date=13 August 2017 |newspaper=The Guardian}}</ref> However, he was criticised for his inconsistency this season, failing to perform as well as the previous season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/tottenham-spurs-news-dele-alli-form-no-concerns-next-match-vs-swansea-a8132646.html |title=Dele Alli has no concerns about his fluctuating form for Spurs this season as he stresses he is still young |date=29 December 2017 |newspaper=The Independent}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/dele-alli-reveals-criticism-or-his-form-have-never-been-a-concern-after-turning-tottenham-corner-a3727661.html |title=Tottenham star Dele Alli says criticism has never been a concern after Spurs turn corner |first=Jack |last=Rosser |date=29 December 2017 |newspaper=London Evening Standard}}</ref> On 1 April 2018, Alli scored twice in the away fixture against Chelsea, helping Tottenham win 3–1, which was their first win in 28 years at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/tottenham-mauricio-pochettino-praises-fighter-dele-alli-star-states-england-case-chelsea-brace-a3803711.html |title=Mauricio Pochettino praises 'fighter' Dele Alli as Tottenham star states England case with Chelsea brace |first=Jack |last=Rosser |date=1 April 2018 |newspaper=London Evening Standard}}</ref>
==== 2018–19 season ==== On 11 August 2018, Alli scored his first goal of the [[2018–19 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|season]], scoring the winning goal in the opening league match against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/newcastle-vs-tottenham/390763 |title=Newcastle 1–2 Tottenham: Dele Alli scores winner for visitors |publisher=Sky Sports|access-date=18 August 2018}}</ref>
On 26 September, Alli was named as [[Captain (association football)|captain]] for Tottenham's [[EFL Cup]] third round tie with [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]. The tie, played at [[Stadium MK]] due to delays in the completion of Tottenham's [[Tottenham Hotspur Stadium|new stadium]], marked Alli's return to the home ground of his boyhood club [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|MK Dons]], and the return to his home town of [[Milton Keynes]] for the first time as a Tottenham player. The tie finished 2–2, with Alli scoring both a [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty]] in normal time and the winning penalty in a deciding [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/2018/september/spurs-v-watford-carabao-cup-match-report/ |title=Dele spot on to send us through in cup |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=26 September 2018 |accessdate=27 September 2018}}</ref>
In October 2018, Alli signed a new six-year deal at Tottenham, which would keep him at the club until 2024.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/oct/30/dele-alli-signs-new-six-year-tottenham-contract-football |title=Dele Alli signs new six-year Tottenham contract to extend stay to 2024 |first=David |last=Hytner |date=30 October 2018 |newspaper=The Guardian |accessdate=30 October 2018}}</ref> He also scored in the 3–1 home win against Chelsea, which was his sixth goal in five games against Chelsea, and the first defeat for Chelsea in the Premier League this season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46244418 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 3 – 1 Chelsea |first=Shamoon |last=Hafez|work=BBC Sport|date= 24 November 2018 |accessdate=25 November 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Alli has made several appearances at U17 and U18 levels for England.<ref>{{Cite news |title=European call for MK Dons and England U17 star Dele Alli |url=http://www.mkweb.co.uk/Sport/Football/MK-Dons/2012-2013/Football-European-call-for-MK-Dons-and-England-U17-star-Dele-Alli-20130307091824.htm |archive-url=https://archive.today/20140626185540/http://www.mkweb.co.uk/Sport/Football/MK-Dons/2012-2013/Football-European-call-for-MK-Dons-and-England-U17-star-Dele-Alli-20130307091824.htm |dead-url=yes |archive-date=26 June 2014 |publisher=MK Web |date=10 April 2013 |accessdate=26 June 2014 }}</ref> On 27 August 2014, Alli was called up to the England U19 squad following an impressive start to the campaign.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/development/2014/aug/u19-squad-germany-oberhausen-izzy-brown-patrick-roberts-joe-gomez |title=Three U17 Euro winners make step up to England U19s |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=3 February 2015}}</ref> He made his debut for England U19 in the 1–1 draw against Germany U19. In the match, Alli assisted the opening goal feeding a through ball to [[Bradley Fewster]] who gave England a 1–0 lead.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/development/2014/sep/germany-england-u19-match-report |title=Germany 1–1 England: Under-19 match international match report |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=3 February 2015}}</ref>
[[File:Dele Alli England.jpg|thumb|245x245px|Alli training with [[England national football team|England]] in 2018]]
In February 2015, it was reported that [[John Fashanu]] would try to convince Alli to play for Nigeria.<ref>{{cite web |title=MK Dons loanee Dele Alli set to be tempted away from England national side by former Wimbledon player |url=http://www.mkweb.co.uk/TOTTENHAM-Dele-Alli-set-tempted-away-England/story-26021516-detail/story.html |publisher=MK Web |accessdate=13 February 2015 |date=13 February 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150213230455/http://www.mkweb.co.uk/TOTTENHAM-Dele-Alli-set-tempted-away-England/story-26021516-detail/story.html |archive-date=13 February 2015 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> However, on 1 October of that year, he was included in [[Roy Hodgson]]'s [[England national football team|England]] squad for the final [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying]] matches against [[Estonia national football team|Estonia]] and [[Lithuania national football team|Lithuania]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Daniel Sturridge left out of England squad for Euro 2016 qualifiers |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34414031 |accessdate=1 October 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 October 2015}}</ref> He made his debut against the former on 9 October, coming on as a late substitute for [[Ross Barkley]] in a 2–0 win.<ref>{{cite web |title=England 2–0 Estonia |url=http://englandstats.com/matches.php?mid=947 |publisher=englandstats |accessdate=10 October 2015 |date=9 October 2015}}</ref>
On 17 November 2015, Alli made his first start for the England senior team, scoring the opening goal from a long range shot to beat Spurs teammate, goalkeeper [[Hugo Lloris]] in a 2–0 win against [[France national football team|France]] at Wembley Stadium.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/nov/18/dele-alli-england-tottenham-france |title=Dele Alli keeping feet on ground despite heroics for England against France |date=18 November 2015 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> He was again named in the starting line-up for England's friendly match against world champions [[Germany national football team|Germany]] on 26 March 2016. Alli was named man of the match by the [[British Broadcasting Corporation|BBC]] as England recovered from 0–2 down to win 3–2 at the Berlin [[Olympiastadion (Berlin)|Olympiastadion]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35849556 |title=Germany 2–3 England |date=26 March 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
[[File:FWC 2018 - Round of 16 - COL v ENG - Photo 004.jpg|thumb|left|Alli (left) during the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] last 16 against [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]] in 2018]]
Alli was selected for the 23-man England [[2018 FIFA World Cup squads#England|squad]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44138600 |title=England World Cup squad: Trent Alexander-Arnold in 23-man squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2018 |accessdate=17 May 2018}}</ref> On 7 July, Alli scored the second goal of the game in a 2–0 win over [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]] in the [[2018 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Sweden vs England|quarter-finals]] of the competition, as England reached the [[2018 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Semi-finals|semi-finals]] for the first time in 28 years.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/sweden-vs-england/385228 |title=Sweden 0–2 England: Harry Maguire and Dele Alli head England into World Cup semis |publisher=Sky Sports|access-date=18 August 2018}}</ref> Alli played for England in the [[2018 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Croatia vs England|semi-final match]] against [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]], winning a free-kick through which England took the lead, though they eventually lost 2–1 following [[Overtime (sports)|extra-time]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44706648 |title=World Cup semi-final: England lose 2–1 to Croatia in extra time |date=11 July 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=18 August 2018}}</ref>
==Player profile== ===Style of play=== Alli is widely considered one of the best young [[midfielder]]s of his generation,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.sportskeeda.com/football/dele-alli-marco-asensio-10-most-valuable-u-23-midfielders/10 |title=10 most valuable U-23 midfielders in the world |first=Ashwin |last=Hanagudu |date=17 May 2017 |website=Sportskeeda}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/1284/Anderlecht/article/detail/3141964/2017/04/25/Tielemans-meest-beslissende-middenvelder-in-Europa.dhtml |title=Tielemans meest beslissende middenvelder in Europa |first=Dimitri |last=Eeckhaut |date=25 May 2017 |website=HLN}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/8/main/2017/05/12/35447392/alli-is-a-freak-and-up-there-with-gerrard-and-scholes-says |title=The 21-year-old is playing well beyond his years whilst sharing the limelight at White Hart Lane alongside fellow England team-mate Harry Kane |date=12 May 2017 |website=Goal.com}}</ref> and has won PFA Young Player of the Year twice in a row while only 21.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/dele-alli-named-pfa-young-player-of-the-year-for-second-season-running-a3521696.html |title=Dele Alli named PFA Young Player of the Year for second season running |first=Alex |last=Young |date=23 April 2017 |newspaper=London Evening Standard}}</ref> He is also considered an all-round player who can play effectively as a [[Forward (association football)#Second striker|second striker]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11675/10843214/why-dele-alli-deserves-to-win-the-pfa-young-player-of-the-year-award |title=Why Dele Alli deserves to win the PFA Young Player of the Year award |first=Gerard |last=Brand |date=25 April 2017 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref> According to [[Mauricio Pochettino]]: "In the box, he looks like a striker, and outside the box, he plays like a midfielder." [[Rafael van der Vaart]] said of Alli that he is "fast, fluid and has a great skill set",<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.eurosport.com/football/dele-alli-is-undoubtedly-good-enough-for-real-madrid-roberto-carlos_sto6151383/story.shtml |title=Dele Alli is 'undoubtedly good enough for Real Madrid' |first=Tom |last=Bennett |publisher=Eurosport |date=3 May 2017}}</ref> while Frank Lampard praised Alli's intelligence in his ability "to get into the box without being marked".<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39660453 |title=Chelsea v Tottenham: Dele Alli's movement sets him apart |first=Frank |last=Lampard |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 April 2017}}</ref>
Alli watches the best players to try to learn from their style of play, including [[Lionel Messi]], [[Xabi Alonso]], [[Andrés Iniesta]] and [[Xavi]] as well as his idol Steven Gerrard.<ref name=telegraph/> His teammate [[Harry Winks]] described Alli as being like [[Fernandinho (footballer)|Fernandinho]], but Dele Alli has described his own playing style as "a cross between Gerrard and [[Yaya Touré]]."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/development/2014/sep/dele-alli-hoping-to-emulate-gerrard |title=Deli Alli hopes to emulate Gerrard |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=3 February 2015}}</ref> Alli has been widely accused of diving and has received bookings for simulation.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Miller |first1=Nick |title=Dele Alli warned by Mauricio Pochettino to cut out diving after booking for simulation in Spurs' rout of Huddersfield |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/dele-alli-dive-warned-mauricio-pochettino-tottenham-spurs-huddersfield-harry-kane-goals-a7975751.html |accessdate=22 February 2018 |newspaper=The Independent |date=30 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Alan Shearer Places Responsibility on Mauricio Pochettino to Stop Dele Alli Diving |url=https://www.si.com/soccer/2018/02/11/alan-shearer-places-responsibility-mauricio-pochettino-stop-dele-alli-diving |accessdate=22 February 2018 |website=Sports Illustrated |date=11 February 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Smith |first1=Alan |title=Dele Alli back in spotlight after 'blatant cheating' |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/the-game/dele-alli-back-in-spotlight-after-blatant-cheating-xcf35m03m |accessdate=22 February 2018 |newspaper=The Times |date=2 October 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Winter |first1=Henry |title=Diving Dele Alli must shun the dark arts |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/alli-is-a-cheat-and-is-in-danger-of-alienating-himself-l0b3tthhz |accessdate=22 February 2018 |newspaper=The Times}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Pitt-Brooke |first1=Jack |title=Arsene Wenger believes English players 'may be the masters' of diving ahead of Arsenal's trip to Tottenham |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/tottenham-spurs-vs-arsenal-north-london-derby-nld-arsene-wenger-pochettino-diving-a8200156.html |accessdate=22 February 2018 |newspaper=The Independent |date=8 February 2018}}</ref>
===Reception=== Alli is considered the world's most expensive midfielder from a transfer value perspective by the [[International Centre for Sports Studies|CIES]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.football-observatory.com/IMG/sites/b5wp/2018/239/en/ |title=Updated transfer valuations: Mbappé takes the lead |publisher=International Centre for Sports Studies (CIES) |first1=Raffaele |last1=Poli |first2=Roger |last2=Besson |first3=Loïc |last3=Ravenel |date=5 November 2018 |accessdate=5 November 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== Alli was born in [[Milton Keynes]], Buckinghamshire,<ref>{{Hugman|22066|accessdate=10 June 2018}}</ref> to a [[Yoruba people|Yoruba]] Nigerian father Kehinde<ref>{{cite news |url=http://theeagleonline.com.ng/dele-alli-may-become-yoruba-king-fashanu/ |title=Dele Alli may become Yoruba king – Fashanu |publisher=Eagle News |date=2 May 2016 |accessdate=13 June 2016}}</ref> and English mother Denise.<ref>{{cite news |first1=Graeme |last1=Culliford |first2=Tracey |last2=Kandohla |date=6 April 2016 |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/archives/news/80787/i-gave-dele-alli-away-at-13-to-save-him-from-gangs-and-allow-him-to-follow-his-football-dream/ |title=I gave Dele Alli away at 13 to save him from gangs and allow him to follow his football dream |newspaper=The Sun |access-date=7 July 2018}}</ref> Kehinde moved to the United States a week after Alli's birth.<ref name="telegraph_story">{{cite news |last=White |first=Jim |title=The Dele Alli story: How a tough upbringing inspired the rise of a Premier League superstar |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/03/05/the-dele-alli-story-how-a-tough-upbringing-inspired-the-rise-of/ |accessdate=12 August 2016 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=4 March 2016}}</ref> Alli was initially brought up by his mother, who suffered from alcohol problems.<ref name="telegraph_story"/> At the age of nine, he moved to Nigeria with his father, where he spent two years in an [[international school]] before returning to Milton Keynes to live with his mother.<ref>{{cite news |first=Patrick |last=Hill |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/dele-allis-estranged-parents-issue-9918748 |title=Dele Alli's estranged parents' tearful plea for England star to let them back into his life |newspaper=Sunday Mirror |date=5 February 2018 |accessdate=7 July 2018}}</ref> Alli went to [[Stantonbury Campus]]<ref name=telegraph>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/mk-dons/11107393/Liverpool-and-Bayern-Munich-target-Dele-Alli-dances-to-his-own-tune-at-MK-Dons.html |title=Liverpool and Bayern Munich target Dele Alli dances to his own tune at MK Dons |date=18 September 2014 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=3 February 2015}}</ref> and [[The Radcliffe School]] in [[Wolverton]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Hytner |first1=David |title=Dele Alli: England's fearless street footballer who can take Euro 2016 by storm |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jun/09/dele-alli-england-euro-2016 |accessdate=5 May 2017 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=9 June 2016}}</ref>
At the age of 13, he moved into the family home of Alan and Sally Hickford, parents of another young footballer with MK Dons and whom he refers to as his "adoptive parents" although he was never legally adopted by them.<ref name="telegraph_story"/><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/dele-allis-mother-gave-tottenham-7151123 |title=Dele Alli's biological mother tells emotional story of Spurs star's childhood |first=Aaron |last=Flanagan |date=10 January 2016}}</ref> In the summer of 2016, Alli elected to stop wearing his surname on his match shirts because he felt no connection with the Alli family name, instead opting for "Dele".<ref name=reason/>
Alli was a Liverpool fan growing up with [[Steven Gerrard]] his childhood idol,<ref name="BBC Sport 19Sep2014"/> and saw Gerrard and [[Frank Lampard]] as good role models on how they act as professionals.<ref name=telegraph/> He is also a fan of [[British hip hop]] music, which led rapper [[Cadet (rapper)|Cadet]] to release a single referencing the footballer, "[[Advice (song)|Advice]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.officialcharts.com/artist/54381/cadet-and-deno-driz/|title="Advice" by Cadet - 2018|publisher=Official Charts Company|accessdate=29 December 2018}}</ref>
