{{pp-pc1}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2017}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Christian Eriksen | image = EriksenTottenham2016(cropped) 2.jpg | image_size = | caption = Eriksen playing for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in 2016 | fullname = Christian Dannemann Eriksen<ref name=Hugman>{{Hugman|26123|accessdate=27 May 2017}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1992|2|14|df=y}}<ref name=Hugman/> | birth_place = [[Middelfart]], Denmark | height = 1.82 m<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/4845/Christian-Eriksen/overview |title=Christian Eriksen: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=1 November 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|Attacking midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | clubnumber = 23 | youthyears1 = 1995–2005 | youthclubs1 = [[Middelfart G&BK]] | youthyears2 = 2005–2008 | youthclubs2 = [[Odense Boldklub|OB]] | youthyears3 = 2008–2010 | youthclubs3 = [[Ajax Youth Academy|Ajax]] | years1 = 2010–2013 | clubs1 = [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] | caps1 = 113 | goals1 = 25 | years2 = 2013– | clubs2 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | caps2 = 198 | goals2 = 46 | nationalyears1 = 2007–2009 | nationalteam1 = [[Denmark national under-17 football team|Denmark U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 27 | nationalgoals1 = 9 | nationalyears2 = 2009 | nationalteam2 = [[Denmark national under-18 football team|Denmark U18]] | nationalcaps2 = 5 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | nationalyears3 = 2009 | nationalteam3 = [[Denmark national under-19 football team|Denmark U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 3 | nationalgoals3 = 1 | nationalyears4 = 2011 | nationalteam4 = [[Denmark national under-21 football team|Denmark U21]] | nationalcaps4 = 3 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | nationalyears5 = 2010– | nationalteam5 = [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]] | nationalcaps5 = 86 | nationalgoals5 = 26 | club-update = 14:56, 14 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20:50, 21 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Christian Dannemann Eriksen''' ({{IPA-da|ˈkʁεsdjan ˈdanəman ˈeˀɐ̯iksn̩}}; born 14 February 1992) is a Danish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]] for {{English football updater|TottenhH}} club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and the [[Denmark national football team|Denmark national team]]. He made his debut for the Denmark national team in March 2010, and was the youngest player of the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] in South Africa.<ref name=youngest>{{cite web |url=http://sport.stv.tv/fifa-world-cup/180776-world-cup-squads-the-story-of-the-stats/ |title=World Cup squads: The story of the stats | FIFA World Cup 2010 | |publisher=STV Sport |date=2 June 2010 |accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref><ref name=youngest2>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/news/newsid=1611883.html |publisher=UEFA |date=23 May 2011 |first=Berend |last=Scholten |title=Eriksen: I've got a lot to learn |accessdate=22 January 2013}}</ref>
In 2011, Eriksen was named [[Danish Football Player of the Year]], [[Dutch Football Talent of the Year]], [[List of AFC Ajax records#AFC Ajax prize winners|Ajax Talent of the Year]] ([[Marco van Basten]] Award), and made the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship#Team of the Tournament|UEFA Euro U-21 Team of the Tournament]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/sports/2011-11/08/c_131234281.htm |title=Eriksen selected as Danish "Player of the Year" |agency=Xinhua News Agency |date=8 November 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150114162516/http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/sports/2011-11/08/c_131234281.htm |archivedate=14 January 2015}}</ref> He also won the Eredivisie with Ajax in [[2010–11 Eredivisie|2010–11]], [[2011–12 Eredivisie|2011–12]] and in [[2012–13 Eredivisie|2012–13]] before departing for Tottenham in August 2013 for a reported fee of around £11.5 million.<ref name=spurssigning>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11675/8898245/tottenham-confirm-the-signing-of-midfielder-christian-eriksen-from-ajax |title=Tottenham confirm the signing of midfielder Christian Eriksen from Ajax |publisher=Sky Sports |date=31 August 2013 |accessdate=19 March 2017 |language=en}}</ref> He won the Tottenham Hotspur Player of the Year award for the 2013–14 season and the 2016-2017 season. In 2018 he won his fifth [[Danish Football Player of the Year]] award.
==Club career== ===Early career in Middelfart and Odense=== Born in [[Middelfart]], Denmark, Eriksen followed in his father Thomas' footsteps when he started playing football in the academy of local side, [[Middelfart G&BK|Middelfart]].<ref name=makings>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jun/15/christian-eriksen-making-of-denmark-tottenham |title=The making of Christian Eriksen: from the start he was a ‘wow’ footballer |publisher=The Guardian |last=Ames |first=Nick |date=15 June 2018 |accessdate=25 June 2018}}</ref> Eriksen's father was also one of the coaches at the time and in 2004 they helped the youth side finish unbeaten in the local youth championship for the third time in a period of four years.<ref name=makings/> The following year, he joined [[Odense Boldklub]] who competed in the Danish youth championships and within a year had helped the club to an age-group title. It was at OB that Eriksen first began showing signs of his technical ability, with his dribbling and free-kick techniques lauded by then-coach, Tonny Hermansen.<ref name=makings/> His form at youth level attracted the attention of a number of major European clubs, including the likes [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]].<ref>{{cite news |title=FC Barcelona kigger på OB-talent |date=4 April 2008 |newspaper=[[B.T. (tabloid)|BT]] |url=http://www.bt.dk/sport/fc-barcelona-kigger-paa-ob-talent |first=Niels |last=Hansen |language=Danish}}</ref> Eriksen ultimately underwent trials with both clubs as well as [[Real Madrid CF|Real Madrid]], [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and [[A.C. Milan|Milan]], but finally decided to move to [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]], stating, "My first step should not be too big. I knew that playing in the Netherlands would be very good for my development. Then Ajax arrived and that was a fantastic option."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.voetbalzone.nl/doc.asp?uid=139277 |title='De eerste stap moest niet te groot zijn, Ajax was fantastische optie' |publisher=Voetbalzone |date=28 February 2011 |accessdate=28 February 2011 |language=Dutch}}</ref>
===Ajax=== ====2008–2010: Youth and first-team squad==== [[File:EriksenAjax3.jpg|thumb|Eriksen represented [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] between 2008 and 2013 during which time he helped the club to four [[Eredivisie]] titles.]]
On 17 October 2008, Eriksen signed a two-and-a-half-year contract with [[Amsterdam]]-based club, [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]].<ref name=uefastarlet>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=762604.html |title=Danish starlet Eriksen opts for Ajax |publisher=UEFA |date=17 October 2008 |accessdate=19 April 2010}}</ref> The [[transfer fee]] received by OB was estimated at €1 million (£847,199) while Middelfart also received a sum of €35 000 which they later used to construct a football pitch.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sport.co.uk/news/Football/34596/_Wenger_eager_to_sign_up_Ajax_starlet_after_Bergkamps_endorsemsent_.aspx |title=Wenger eager to sign up Ajax starlet after Bergkamp's endorsemsent |website=Sport.co.uk |first=Nigel |last=Brown |date=23 February 2010 |accessdate=2 June 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100226101000/http://www.sport.co.uk/news/Football/34596/_Wenger_eager_to_sign_up_Ajax_starlet_after_Bergkamps_endorsemsent_.aspx |archivedate=26 February 2010}}</ref><ref name=makings/> He worked his way through the youth teams at Ajax and was promoted to the [[first team]] squad in January 2010, where he was given the number 51 shirt.<ref name=uefafaith/> Later that month, he made his first team debut in a 1–1 [[Eredivisie]] with [[NAC Breda]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Eriksen fik debut i Ajax |language=Danish |date=17 January 2010 |accessdate=17 January 2010 |publisher=[[DR (broadcaster)|Danmarks Radio]] |url=http://www.dr.dk/Sporten/Fodbold/2010/01/17/160629.htm}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://talksport.com/uncategorized/100325/christian-eriksen-player-every-club-wants-ten-things-you-need-know/ |title=Christian Eriksen – The player every club wants: Ten things you need to know |publisher=talkSport |last=Mannion |first=Damian |date=10 February 2011 |accessdate=25 June 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Ajax on 25 March in a 6–0 win over [[Go Ahead Eagles]] in the [[KNVB Cup|Dutch Cup]] and extended his contract with the club the following month.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.elfvoetbal.nl/Overige/181292/Supertalent-Eriksen-tot-2014-bij-Ajax |title=Supertalent Eriksen tot 2014 bij Ajax |publisher=ELF Voetbal |date=10 April 2010 |accessdate=11 March 2018 |language=Dutch}}</ref> On 6 May, he played in the second match of the final of the [[2009–10 KNVB Cup|2009–10 Dutch Cup]] as Ajax beat [[Feyenoord]] 4–1, prevailing 6–1 on aggregate.<ref name=2010cup>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=291558&cc=5739 |title=Report: Feyenoord Rotterdam vs Ajax Amsterdam – Dutch Cup |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=6 May 2010 |accessdate=2 June 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100508052455/http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=291558&cc=5739 |archivedate=8 May 2010}}</ref> At the end of his first professional season with the club, Eriksen had played 21 competitive matches, scoring one goal, and had made his international debut for Denmark.<ref name=SW/><ref name=debut/> Eriksen's form throughout the campaign earned praise from manager [[Martin Jol]] who compared him to former youth products [[Wesley Sneijder]] and [[Rafael van der Vaart]] as well as Danish legend, [[Michael Laudrup]] for his reading of the game in the traditional [[Playmaker|"number 10" role]].<ref name=uefafaith>{{cite news |title=Eriksen puts faith in Ajax way by Berend Scholten |url=http://www.uefa.com/news/newsid=1459745.html#eriksen+puts+faith+ajax |publisher=UEFA |date=13 March 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.imscouting.com/global-news-article/Christian-Eriksen-The-new-Laudrup/7979/ |title=Christian Eriksen: The new Laudrup |publisher=IMScouting |date=27 May 2010 |accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref>
====2010–2013: Breakthrough years====
Eriksen took the number eight jersey ahead of the following campaign and began the [[2010–11 Eredivisie|2010–11 season]] well, scoring his first Ajax league goal on 29 August 2010 in an away victory over [[De Graafschap]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.parool.nl/parool/nl/13/AJAX/article/detail/305683/2010/07/16/Ajax-maakt-rugnummers-bekend.dhtml |title=Ajax maakt rugnummers bekend |newspaper=Het Parool |date=19 July 2010 |accessdate=20 July 2010 |language=Dutch}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/08/29/netherlands/eredivisie/bv-de-graafschap/afc-ajax/941442/ |title=De Graafschap vs. Ajax |website=Soccerway |date=29 August 2010 |accessdate=11 February 2011}}</ref> Over the course of the next few months, he scored his first home goal at the [[Amsterdam Arena]], in a 3–0 Cup victory over [[SC Veendam|BV Veendam]], and his first European goal, in a 3–0 [[UEFA Europa League]] win over [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/11/11/netherlands/knvb-beker/afc-ajax/veendam-1894/1038712/ |title=Ajax vs. Veendam |website=Soccerway |date=11 November 2010 |accessdate=11 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season=2011/round=2000129/match=2003770/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Ruthless Ajax make Anderlecht pay the penalty |publisher=UEFA |date=17 February 2011 |accessdate=6 June 2011}}</ref> In between the milestone goals, Eriksen was also named [[Danish Football Player of the Year#Danish Football Association's award|Danish Talent of the Year]].<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web |url=http://www.dr.dk/Sporten/Fodbold/Landsholdet/2010/12/07/215702.htm |title=Christian Eriksen er Årets Talent 2010 |publisher=Danmarks Radio |first=Rikke |last=Darfelt |date=7 December 2010 |accessdate=11 February 2011 |language=Danish}}</ref> His growing capabilities as the team's playmaker saw him become an undisputed starter in the side and he helped Ajax to their first [[2010–11 Eredivisie|Eredivisie title]] in seven years. At the end of the season he was named Ajax's [[List of AFC Ajax records and statistics#AFC Ajax prize winners|Talent of the Year]].<ref name=ajaxtalent>{{cite web |url=http://www.ajax.nl/Nieuws/Nieuwsarchief/Nieuws-artikel/Stekelenburg-Ajacied-van-het-Jaar.htm |title=Stekelenburg Ajacied van het Jaar, Christian Eriksen Talent van het Jaar |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=15 May 2011 |accessdate=6 June 2011 |language=Dutch}}</ref> His form throughout the campaign also earned him the [[Dutch Football Talent of the Year]] award which saw him become only the second Danish player to win the award since [[Jon Dahl Tomasson]] in 1996. [[Johan Cruyff]], whose panel selected Eriksen for the award, described Eriksen as a typical product of the Danish school and added to previous comparisons between him and [[Brian Laudrup|Brian]] and Michael Laudrup."<ref name=talentned>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/news/newsid=1634341.html#janssen+voted+eredivisies+best |title=Janssen named Netherlands' finest |publisher=UEFA |date=23 May 2011 |accessdate=6 June 2011 |first=Berend |last=Scholten}}</ref>
[[File:EriksenAjax2.jpg|thumb|Eriksen (right) playing for [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] against [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]] in 2011.]]
On 18 October 2011, Eriksen scored his first goal in the [[UEFA Champions League]] when Ajax beat [[GNK Dinamo Zagreb|Dinamo Zagreb]] 2–0 in the [[2011–12 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/1642569#slide3 |title=Christian Eriksen to Liverpool: Tracking the Evolution of the Rumour |publisher=Bleacher Report |last=Greene |first=Laura |date=17 May 2013 |accessdate=25 June 2018}}</ref> In the return fixture the following month, he provided assists to teammates [[Gregory van der Wiel]] and [[Siem de Jong]] as Ajax recorded a 4–0 victory.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2012/matches/round=2000263/match=2007632/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Stylish Ajax eliminate Dinamo |publisher=UEFA |date=2 November 2011}}</ref> Five days later he was named [[Danish Football Player of the Year]] in recognition of his role in helping Ajax to the league title the season before and in Denmark's successful [[UEFA Euro 2012]] qualification campaign.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=den/news/newsid=1714527.html |title=Eriksen and Pedersen honoured in Denmark |publisher=UEFA |first=Peter |last=Bruun |date=8 November 2011}}</ref> Eriksen continued to impress for Ajax and his strong contribution, both in terms of goal and assist returns, helped the club to a second consecutive league title.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2601/features/2012/05/11/3095096/goalcoms-eredivisie-team-of-the-season-vertonghen-eriksen |title=Goal.com's Eredivisie Team of the Season: Vertonghen, Eriksen & Dost make the cut |publisher=Goal |date=11 May 2012 |accessdate=25 June 2018}}</ref>
Eriksen and Ajax repeated the feat in the [[2012–13 Eredivisie|2012–13 season]] following which he opted not to renew his contract with the club. With only one year remaining on his current contract, Eriksen was permitted to search for a new club and he agreed terms with [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in England. Eriksen departed Ajax having made 162 appearances across all competitions and scored 32 goals. Along with his league success, he had also featured in three consecutive editions of the [[Johan Cruyff Shield]], which Ajax won once.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ajaxshowtime.com/bijzaken-en-geruchten/72894/de-statistieken-van-ruim-vier-jaar-eriksen.html |title=De statistieken van ruim vier jaar Eriksen |publisher=Ajax Showtime |date=30 August 2013}}</ref>
===Tottenham Hotspur=== ====2013–2015: Premier League introduction and League Cup runner-up==== On 30 August 2013, [[Premier League]] club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] announced that they had completed the transfer of Eriksen from Ajax in a deal believed to be worth £11 million (€12.45 million).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/eriksen-arrives-300813/ |title=Eriksen Arrives |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=30 August 2013 |accessdate=30 August 2013}}</ref> Eriksen joined the club on the same day as [[Erik Lamela]], who joined from [[A.S. Roma|Roma]], and [[Vlad Chiricheș]], who joined from [[FC Steaua București|Steaua București]], and took the club's total spending for the [[List of English football transfers summer 2013|2013 summer transfer window]] to £109.5 million.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/aug/30/tottenham-hotspur-erik-lamela-christian-eriksen |title=Tottenham's spend passing £110m with Erik Lamela and Christian Eriksen |newspaper=The Guardian |first=David |last=Hytner |date=30 August 2013 |accessdate=30 August 2013}}</ref> He made his league debut against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] on 14 September 2013 and provided an assist for [[Gylfi Sigurðsson]] in a 2–0 victory.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/23999467 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 2–0 Norwich City |date=14 September 2013 |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Luke |last=Reddy}}</ref> After the match, Spurs manager [[André Villas-Boas]] commented, "It was a great debut for Christian, he is a pure number 10, a creative player and his individual quality made all the difference."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2013/09/14/uk-soccer-england-tottenham-idUKBRE98D09O20130914 |agency=Reuters |title=Eriksen proves life goes on for Spurs after Bale |first=Mike |last=Collett |date=14 September 2013}}</ref>
[[File:Christian Eriksen v Arsenal 1314.jpg|thumb|left|Eriksen playing for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in 2014]]
Five days later, Eriksen "clipped a wonderful dipping shot" over the goalkeeper to score his first Tottenham goal and complete a 3–0 win over [[Tromsø IL]] in the [[2013–14 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/300996/report |title=Europa League: Two Jermain Defoe goals secure Tottenham a 3–0 win over Tromso |publisher=Sky Sports |date=19 September 2013 |accessdate=29 May 2014}}</ref> He added to his Tottenham goal tally with a goal from a free kick in a 1–1 draw against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on Boxing Day 2013, and the second goal in Spurs' 1–2 away win against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] on 1 January 2014.<ref>{{cite news |first=Sam |last=Wallace |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-united-1-tottenham-2-match-report-united-unable-to-muster-recovery-after-emmanuel-adebayor-and-christian-eriksen-goals-9033107.html |title=Manchester United 1 Tottenham 2 match report: United unable to muster recovery after Emmanuel Adebayor and Christian Eriksen goals |newspaper=The Independent |date=2 January 2014 |accessdate=19 January 2014}}</ref> On 23 March, after goals from [[Jay Rodriguez]] and [[Adam Lallana]] had given [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] a 2–0 lead against Tottenham at [[White Hart Lane]], Eriksen scored twice to level the score and assisted Sigurðsson to score the winning goal.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/26599215 |title=Tottenham Hotspur 3–2 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Aimee |last=Lewis |date=23 March 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2014}}</ref> He continued his goalscoring form on 12 April 2014 when he scored a stoppage-time equaliser to help Tottenham come from 3–0 down to draw 3–3 at West Brom.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/26898645 |title=West Bromwich Albion 3–3 Tottenham Hotspur |date=12 April 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Andy |last=Cryer}}</ref> By the end of the season, he had scored ten goals and registered 13 assists across all competitions, won the [[Danish Football Player of the Year]] award and was named Tottenham's Player of the Season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://kwese.espn.com/football/club/tottenham-hotspur/367/blog/post/1983117/christian-eriksen-will-follow-the-same-path-as-luka-modric-and-gareth-bale-all-the-way-to-madrid?src=com |title=Eriksen is Tottenham's new galactico |website=ESPN |last=Fitch |first=Dan |date=12 August 2014 |accessdate=11 December 2017}}</ref><ref name=POTS>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/christian-and-deleand39s-club-awards-double-130517/ |title=Christian and Dele's Club Awards Double |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=13 May 2017 |accessdate=16 November 2017}}</ref>
Ahead of the [[2014–15 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2014–15 campaign]], Tottenham appointed [[Mauricio Pochettino]] as new club manager after the unsuccessful period under Villas-Boas and interim-manager [[Tim Sherwood]]. Between November and December 2014, Eriksen scored late winners against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]], [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] and [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] which he credited to the Argentine manager for raising the team's fitness levels.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/dec/15/christian-eriksen-tottenham-late-winners-fitness |title=Christian Eriksen: Tottenham’s late winners down to raised fitness |newspaper=The Guardian |date=15 December 2014 |accessdate=11 December 2017}}</ref> By the end of the calendar year, Eriksen had scored 12 goals from open play – more than any other player in England – and was soon after awarded his second consecutive Danish Footballer of the Year award.<ref name=DPY>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/christian-eriksen-wins-danish-player-of-the-year-for-third-year-running-2016-110116/ |title=Christian Makes History in Denmark |date=11 January 2016 |accessdate=11 December 2017 |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C.}}</ref> On 28 January 2015, Eriksen scored twice in a 2–2 (3–2 aggregate) win over [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] to send Tottenham into the [[2015 Football League Cup Final|League Cup Final]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Sheffield United 2–2 Tottenham Hotspur (agg 2–3) |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/30910040 |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Tom |last=Rostance |date=28 January 2015 |accessdate=28 January 2015}}</ref> His first goal, a 30-yard curling free kick, was later lauded by former professionals [[Michael Owen]] and [[Gary Neville]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://hereisthecity.com/en-gb/2015/01/28/eriksens-stunning-free-kick-onomah-and-ex-spurs-stars-react-on-t/ |title=Eriksen's stunning free-kick: Onomah and ex-Spurs stars react on Twitter |website=Here Is The City |first=Dan |last=Coombs |date=28 January 2015}}</ref> The final, played against London rivals [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], took place on 1 March and ended in a 2–0 defeat for Tottenham.<ref name=LC2015>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31572594 |title=Chelsea 2–0 Tottenham Hotspur |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 March 2015 |accessdate=3 September 2018}}</ref> Eriksen completed the 2014–15 campaign having featured in every Premier League game for [[Mauricio Pochettino]], starting all-but one match, and scored 12 goals across all competitions.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/eriksen-2014-15-goals-220615/ |title=Double Figures Delight – Christian on his 2014–15 goals |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=22 June 2015 |accessdate=11 December 2017}}</ref>
On 9 June 2015, amid speculation that he would be joining [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], Eriksen confirmed to Danish media whilst on international duty that he would stay at Tottenham for the foreseeable future and was quoted as saying, "I feel right at home at Tottenham and I haven't thought about leaving yet."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/447144/Eriksen-to-stay-at-Tottenham |title=Tottenham star: I have absolutely NO intention of joining Manchester United |newspaper=Daily Star |first=Chisanga |last=Malata |date=9 June 2015}}</ref> He did in fact remain with the club and scored his first goals of the season in October, netting from two free-kicks in a 2–2 draw with Swansea.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2575222-why-eriksen-is-the-tottenham-player-who-must-produce-after-international-break |title=Why Eriksen Is the Tottenham Player Who Must Produce After International Break |website=Bleacher Report |last=Cooper |first=Thomas |date=6 October 2015 |accessdate=11 December 2017}}</ref>
====2016–present: Premier League runner-up and PFA Team of the Year==== [[File:Eriksen20162(cropped).jpg|thumb|Eriksen striking a [[free-kick]] while playing for Tottenham in 2016]]
In January 2016, Eriksen was once again named Danish Footballer of the Year. In doing so he became the first ever player to win the award in three consecutive years.<ref name=DPY/> He ultimately scored 6 goals and registered 13 assists as Tottenham ended the league season in third place, thereby qualifying for the following season's [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] campaign.<ref name=BR>{{cite web |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2654675-christian-eriksen-tottenham-agree-on-new-contract-latest-details-and-reaction |title=Christian Eriksen, Tottenham Agree on New Contract: Latest Details and Reaction |website=Bleacher Report |last=Marsden |first=Rory |date=6 September 2017 |accessdate=11 December 2017}}</ref>
The [[2016–17 Premier League|following season]], Eriksen signed a new long-term contract with Tottenham and starred once again for the club, scoring eight goals and assisting a further 15 as the club ended the league campaign as runners-up to champions [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/story/goal-50-english/ |title=Goal 50 – Journalists from across Goal's 37 editions voted in the 10th annual award for the world's 50 best footballers |publisher=Goal.com |accessdate=16 November 2017}}</ref> Eriksen's tally of assists was bettered only by [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]'s [[Kevin De Bruyne]] who set up 18 goals for the season.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://talksport.com/football/premier-league-assists-201617-who-created-most-goals-season-170521240072?p=10 |title=Premier League assists 2016/17: Who created the most goals this season? |website=talkSPORT |date=21 May 2017 |accessdate=16 November 2017}}</ref> Eriksen also recorded the joint-most assists in the [[FA Cup]] and later won the Tottenham Player of the Season award, claiming the award for the second time after previously winning it in his debut season with the club.<ref name=FAC>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/english-fa-cup/40/statistics/assists?season=2016 |title=English FA Cup Statistics |publisher=ESPN FC |access-date=22 October 2017}}</ref><ref name=POTS/>
Eriksen broke the record for the most goals scored by a Danish player in the Premier League when he scored his 33rd goal in a 3–2 win over [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on 23 September 2017, surpassing the record previously held by [[Nicklas Bendtner]].<ref name=DP>{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/tottenham-hotspur-christian-eriksen-record-breaking-premier-league-goal-nicklas-bendtner-arsenal-a7964126.html |title=Christian Eriksen happy to move Nicklas Bendtner to the side after his record-breaking goal against West Ham |website=The Independent |date=24 September 2017 |accessdate=11 December 2017}}</ref> On 9 December, he made his 200th career appearance for Tottenham and marked the occasion by scoring in a 5–1 Premier League win over [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/first-team/match/report/spurs-v-stoke-city-match-report-091217/ |title=Spurs 5–1 Stoke – Report from Wembley |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=9 December 2017 |accessdate=10 December 2017}}</ref> The following month, he scored his 50th goal for the club when he netted after just 11 seconds in the 2–0 league win over Manchester United.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-za/news/eriksen-scores-after-11-seconds-for-spurs-against-man-utd/ypvppsdummy71vo012e2g8sfo |title=Eriksen scores after 11 seconds for Spurs against Man Utd |publisher=Goal.com |last=Floyd |first=Thomas |date=31 January 2018 |accessdate=1 February 2018}}</ref> Eriksen's goal was the third-fastest goal ever scored in the Premier League era, bettered only by [[Alan Shearer]] and former Spurs captain [[Ledley King]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2018/jan/31/eriksen-scores-after-11-seconds-for-2nd-fastest-ep/ |title=Eriksen scores after 11 seconds for 3rd fastest EPL goal |newspaper=The Washington Times |date=31 January 2018 |accessdate=2 February 2018}}</ref> On 17 March 2018, Eriksen scored twice in an [[2017–18 FA Cup|FA Cup]] fixture against Swansea to send Spurs to the semi-final for the second season running.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43353565 |title=Swansea City 0–3 Tottenham Hotspur |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Michael |last=Pearlman |date=17 March 2018 |accessdate=17 March 2018}}</ref> On 1 April 2018, Ericksen scored a 25-yard goal in the away match against Chelsea, helping Tottenham to their first win in 28 years at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] in a match that finished 3–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11661/11313452/watch-christian-eriksens-rainbow-stunner-in-tottenhams-win-over-chelsea |title=WATCH: Christian Eriksen's 'rainbow' stunner in Tottenham's win over Chelsea |date=1 April 2018 |work=Sky Sports}}</ref> Later that month, in the reverse fixture against Stoke, Eriksen scored twice to earn Tottenham a 2–1 win. Following the match, however, teammate Harry Kane, who was challenging for the season's [[Premier League Golden Boot|Golden Boot]] award, claimed to have made the last touch on the ball for the second goal. Tottenham appealed to the Premier League panel who agreed that the ball touched Kane's shoulder and awarded him the goal.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43602488 |title=Stoke City 1–2 Tottenham |date=7 April 2018 |accessdate=11 April 2018 |first=Neil |last=Johnston}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43731208 |title=Premier League: Tottenham goal at Stoke awarded to Harry Kane |date=11 April 2018 |accessdate=11 April 2018}}</ref> On 14 April, Eriksen was named in the [[PFA Team of the Year]] for the first time, alongside teammates Kane and [[Jan Vertonghen]].<ref name=1718PFA>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43810017 |title=Manchester City players dominate PFA team of the year |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 April 2018 |accessdate=5 May 2018}}</ref>
In the [[2018–19 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2018–19 season]], Eriksen scored his first goal of the season in the [[2018–19 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] away match against [[Inter Milan]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/inter-vs-tottenham/401830 |title=Inter 2-1 Tottenham: Two late goals stun Spurs in Champions League opener|first= Gerard|last= Brand|date= 19 September 2018 |work= Sky Sports}}</ref> The match ended in a 2–1 loss for Tottenham, but in the home game against Inter, Eriksen scored again in the only goal of the game, giving Tottenham a 1–0 victory.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/tottenham-vs-inter-milan-result-champions-league-2018-goals-score-report-latest-a8657116.html |title=Tottenham vs Inter Milan: Christian Eriksen scores from the bench to give Spurs Champions League lifeline|first=Miguel |last=Delaney |date=28 November 2018 |work=The Independent }}</ref> He scored his first Premier League goal of the season on 15 December 2018 in the home match against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], a late goal that earned Tottenham a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/dec/15/tottenham-burnley-premier-league-match-report|title=Christian Eriksen’s late strike gives Tottenham win over Burnley|first=Nick |last=Miller |date=15 December 2018|work=The Guardian }}</ref>
==International career== ===Youth squads=== Eriksen was called up to the [[Denmark national under-17 football team]] in July 2007,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dbu.dk/news/newsShow.aspx?id=239942 |title=U/17-landsholdet til Internordisk Cup |publisher=Danish Football Association |date=9 July 2007 |accessdate=6 June 2010 |language=Danish}}</ref> and impressed in his debut for the team on 31 July.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dbu.dk/news/newsShow.aspx?id=240235 |title=Tre point mod Færøerne |publisher=Danish Football Association |date=31 July 2007 |accessdate=6 June 2010 |language=Danish}}</ref> In 2008, he scored nine goals in 16 games for the U-17s, and was named [[Danish Football Player of the Year#Young Players of the Year|Danish U-17 Talent of the Year]] by the [[Danish Football Association|Danish FA]].<ref name=dbu>{{cite web |url=http://www.dbu.dk/news/newsShow.aspx?id=250290 |title=Lumb og Eriksen nyeste Arla Landsholdstalenter |publisher=Danish Football Association |date=5 December 2008 |accessdate=6 June 2010 |language=Danish}}</ref> He was also one of four nominees for the 2008 Danish Talent of the Year award,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dbu.dk/news/newsShow.aspx?id=249275 |title=Danmarks fire største talenter |publisher=Danish Football Association |date=24 October 2008 |accessdate=6 June 2010 |language=Danish}}</ref> which was won by [[Mathias Jørgensen]].<ref name=dbu/> He played 27 games for the under-17 team until February 2009. He played a total of eight games for the [[Denmark national under-18 football team|Denmark U-18]] and [[Denmark national under-19 football team|Denmark U-19]] teams during 2009. Eriksen was also called up for the Danish U-21 squad to the European championship in Denmark in 2011, the Danish team only participated in the group stage and Eriksen scored a goal against Belarus.
===Senior squad=== [[File:Eriksen Euro 2012.jpg|thumb|Eriksen playing for [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]] at [[UEFA Euro 2012]]]]
Eriksen received his first senior Denmark call-up in February 2010,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bold.dk/nyt/Christian-Eriksen-Det-er-helt-vildt |title=Christian Eriksen: Det er helt vildt |website=Bold.dk |date=26 February 2010 |accessdate=13 April 2010 |language=Danish}}</ref> making his debut in Denmark's friendly match against [[Austria national football team|Austria]] in March,<ref name=debut>{{cite web |url=http://sporten-dyn.tv2.dk/article.php/id-29005205.html?rss |title=Eriksen: Helt specielt med debut – TV 2 Sporten |publisher=Sporten-dyn.tv2.dk |date= |accessdate=13 April 2010 |language=Danish}}</ref> to become Denmark's fourth youngest full international, being the youngest debutant since Michael Laudrup.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.haslund.info/danmark/aovs/ydeb.asp |title=A-landsholdspillere – Yngste debutant |publisher=www.haslund.info |date= |accessdate=18 May 2010 |language=Danish |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110721203507/http://www.haslund.info/danmark/aovs/ydeb.asp |archivedate=21 July 2011}}</ref>
On 28 May 2010, Denmark coach [[Morten Olsen]] announced that Eriksen would be part of the final squad of 23 participating in the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] in South Africa.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/news/newsid=1493391.html |title=Olsen names final Denmark squad |publisher=UEFA |date=28 May 2010 |accessdate=2 June 2010}}</ref> He was the youngest player participating in the tournament.<ref name=youngest/><ref name=youngest2/> At the World Cup, Eriksen played two matches, against the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] and [[Japan national football team|Japan]], but Denmark were unable to progress beyond the group stage.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/06/14/world/world-cup/netherlands/denmark/878795/ |title=Netherlands vs. Denmark |website=Soccerway |date=17 November 2010 |accessdate=11 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/06/24/world/world-cup/denmark/japan/878799/ |title=Denmark vs. Japan |website=Soccerway |date=24 June 2010 |accessdate=11 February 2011}}</ref>
On 9 February 2011, in a 2–1 friendly loss at home against [[England national football team|England]], Eriksen was named [[man of the match]], and was praised for his performance by a number of prominent footballing figures, including [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] star [[Frank Lampard]],<ref>{{cite news |url=http://spn.dk/fodbold/landshold/article2335072.ece |title=Stjerne: Eriksen kan blive topspiller |newspaper=Jyllands-Posten Sport |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=10 February 2011 |language=Danish}}</ref> Man Utd star [[Rio Ferdinand]] (on Twitter),<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sporten.dk/fodbold/ferdinand-skamroser-eriksen-paa-twitter |title=Ferdinand skamroser Eriksen på Twitter |publisher=Sporten.dk |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=10 February 2011 |language=Danish}}</ref> manager Morten Olsen and several media experts in Denmark and England.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://spn.dk/fodbold/landshold/article2335260.ece |title=Engelske medier jubler over Eriksen |newspaper=Jyllands-Posten Sport |date=9 February 2011 |accessdate=10 February 2011 |language=Danish |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20120720044254/http://jyllands-posten.dk/sport/fodbold/landshold/article2335260.ece |archivedate=20 July 2012}}</ref> On 4 June 2011, Eriksen scored his first national team goal to give Denmark a 2–0 lead over [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]] in their [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying Group H|Euro 2012 qualifier]]. In doing so, he became the youngest Danish player ever to score a goal in European qualification, being nine days younger than Michael Laudrup when he scored his first goal in 1983.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ad.nl/ad/nl/1441/Ajax/article/detail/2441812/2011/06/06/Ajacied-Eriksen-speelt-Laudrup-uit-de-boeken.dhtml |title=Ajacied Eriksen speelt Laudrup uit de boeken |publisher=Ad.nl |date=16 May 2011 |accessdate=6 June 2011 |language=Dutch}}</ref>
====2018 FIFA World Cup qualification and tournament==== In the build-up to the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], Denmark were drawn in [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Group E|UEFA Group E]] alongside the likes of [[Poland national football team|Poland]] and [[Romania national football team|Romania]]. Eriksen played a key-role during the nation's qualification campaign during which time he scored eight goals to earn Denmark a play-off against the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/great-dane-eriksen-is-danger-forireland-372f7gngj |title=Christian Eriksen is danger for Ireland |publisher=The Times |last=Hawkey |first=Ian |date=5 November 2017 |accessdate=15 November 2017}}</ref> The first leg of the play-off ended in a 0–0 home draw before Eriksen netted a [[hat-trick]] in [[Dublin]]'s [[Aviva Stadium]] in a 5–1 win to earn Denmark a spot at the World Cup.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41884909 |title=Republic of Ireland 1–5 Denmark (agg: 1–5) |last=Hafez |first=Shamoon |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 November 2017 |accessdate=14 November 2017}}</ref> Eriksen's treble took his tally to 11 goals for the qualification campaign, bettered only by Poland's [[Robert Lewandowski]] (16) and [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]]'s [[Cristiano Ronaldo]] (15) in Europe, and earned the praise of national team manager [[Åge Hareide]] who stated that Eriksen was one of the top 10 players in the world.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/17248/11127219/tottenhams-christian-eriksen-one-of-the-worlds-top-10-players-says-denmark-boss-age-hareide |title=Tottenham's Christian Eriksen one of the world's top 10 players, says Denmark boss Age Hareide |publisher=Sky Sports |date=15 November 2017 |accessdate=15 November 2017}}</ref>
In Denmark's opening match at the tournament, Eriksen assisted [[Yussuf Poulsen]] for the only goal in a 1–0 win over [[Peru national football team|Peru]] before scoring his first goal for the tournament in the 1–1 draw with [[Australia national soccer team|Australia]] the following week.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/christian-eriksen-denmark-world-cup-2018-thomas-delaney-australia-a8411006.html |title=World Cup 2018: ‘Great things happen’ when you play alongside Christian Eriksen, Denmark’s shining star |publisher=The Independent |last=Miller |first=Nick |date=22 June 2018 |accessdate=22 June 2018}}</ref> Denmark ultimately progressed from their [[2018 FIFA World Cup Group C|group]] after which they were drawn with [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]] in the [[2018 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Round of 16|Round of 16]]. There they were defeated after a [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]], with Eriksen being one of three players to have his spot-kick saved by Croatia goalkeeper [[Danijel Subašić]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jul/01/croatia-luka-modric-christian-eriksen-denmark-world-cup |title=Croatia’s Luka Modric fluffs big line but still prevails in duel with Eriksen |publisher=The Guardian |last=Pender |first=Kieran |date=1 July 2018 |accessdate=2 July 2018}}</ref>
On 9 September 2018, Eriksen scored twice in a 2–0 win over [[Wales national football team|Wales]] to lead Denmark to victory in the nation's inaugural [[UEFA Nations League]] match.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/sep/09/denmark-wales-nations-league-match-report |title=Double from Denmark’s Christian Eriksen brings Wales down to earth |publisher=The Guardian |last=Candy |first=James |date=9 September 2018 |accessdate=11 September 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== Eriksen lives with his girlfriend Sabrina Kvist Jensen in [[Hampstead]], London.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.seoghoer.dk/nyheder/det-hedder-soennike |title=Christian Eriksen deler sød hemmelighed: Det hedder sønnike |work=SE og HØR |date=31 December 2018}}</ref> Their first child, Alfred, was born on 4 June 2018.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bt.dk/fodbold/har-holdt-det-hemmeligt-i-maanedsvis-nu-afsloerer-christian-eriksen-soennens-navn |title=Har holdt det hemmeligt i månedsvis: Nu afslører Christian Eriksen sønnens navn|work=B.T. |date=31 December 2018 }}</ref>

==Honours== '''Ajax''' *[[Eredivisie]]: [[2010–11 Eredivisie|2010–11]], [[2011–12 Eredivisie|2011–12]], [[2012–13 Eredivisie|2012–13]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://english.ajax.nl/The-Club/Trophies.htm |title=Trophies |publisher=AFC Ajax |date=20 January 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150120170833/http://english.ajax.nl/The-Club/Trophies.htm |archivedate=20 January 2015}}</ref> *[[KNVB Cup]]: [[2009–10 KNVB Cup|2009–10]]<ref name=2010cup/> *[[Johan Cruyff Shield]]: [[2013 Johan Cruyff Shield|2013]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rsssf.com/tablesn/nedsupcuphist.html |title=Netherlands – List of Super Cup Finals |publisher=Rec.Sport.Soccer Statistics Foundation |accessdate=20 January 2015}}</ref>
'''Tottenham Hotspur''' *[[Football League Cup]] runner-up: [[2014–15 Football League Cup|2014–15]]<ref name=LC2015/>
'''Individual''' *[[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] Talent of the Future: 2010<ref name=spurssigning/> *Ajax Talent of the Year: 2011<ref name=ajaxtalent/> *[[Danish Football Player of the Year#Young Players of the Year|Danish U-17 Talent of the Year]]: 2008<ref name=uefastarlet/> *[[Danish Football Player of the Year|Danish Talent of the Year]]: 2010, 2011<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.insidefutbol.com/2015/01/10/tottenham-hotspur-star-christian-eriksen-wins-danish-player-of-the-year-award/182406/ |title=Tottenham Hotspur Star Christian Eriksen Wins Danish Player of the Year Award |publisher=Inside Futbol |date=10 January 2015 |accessdate=20 January 2015}}</ref> *[[Dutch Football Talent of the Year]]: 2011<ref name=talentned/> *[[Dutch Footballer of the Year]] Bronze Boot: 2012<ref name=spurssigning/> *[[Danish Football Player of the Year]]: 2013, 2014, 2015, 2017, 2018<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/christian-danish-award-110115/ |title=Christian takes top Danish honour for second-successive year |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=11 January 2015 |accessdate=20 January 2015}}</ref> *[[Danish Football Player of the Year#Danish Football Association's award|Danish Football Player of the Year]] by TV2 and DFA: 2011, 2013, 2014, 2017 *[[PFA Team of the Year]]: [[PFA Team of the Year (2010s)#Premier League 9|2017–18 Premier League]]<ref name=1718PFA/> *[[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] Player of the Year: [[2013–14 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2013–14]], [[2016–17 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2016–17]]<ref name=POTS/><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/christian-eriksen-on-awards-140514/ |title=Christian's pride |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=11 January 2015 |accessdate=20 January 2015}}</ref> *[[Premier League Goal of the Month]]: [[2017–18 Premier League#Monthly awards|April 2018]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/682718 |title=Eriksen strike wins Carling Goal of the Month |publisher=Premier League |date=9 May 2018 |accessdate=9 May 2018}}</ref>
'''Records''' *First footballer to win three consecutive [[Danish Football Player of the Year]] awards.<ref name=DPY/> *Most goals scored by a Danish footballer in the [[Premier League]]<ref name=DP/> (41).

clubs2 = [[Toulouse FC|Toulouse]] | caps2 = 72 | goals2 = 8 | years3 = 2014–2015 | clubs3 = → [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] (loan) | caps3 = 14 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2015–2017 | clubs4 = [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] | caps4 = 43 | goals4 = 2 | years5 = 2017– | clubs5 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | caps5 = 25 | goals5 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2013– | nationalteam1 = [[Ivory Coast national football team|Ivory Coast]] | nationalcaps1 = 48 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | club-update = 08:07, 24 February 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 9 September 2018 }} '''Serge Alain Stephane Aurier''' ({{IPA-fr|sɛʁʒ oʁje|lang}}; born 24 December 1992) is an Ivorian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and the [[Ivory Coast national football team|Ivory Coast national team]].
Aurier moved to France as a child and played for [[RC Lens|Lens]], [[Toulouse FC|Toulouse]] and [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]], winning 11 major trophies with the last. He totalled 169 appearances in [[Ligue 1]] and was twice named in the competition's [[Trophées UNFP du football|Team of the Year]]. In 2017, he joined Tottenham for a fee of around £23 million.
He made his international debut for the Ivory Coast in 2013 and has earned over 40 caps. He represented the nation at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and two [[Africa Cup of Nations]] tournaments, winning the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations|2015 edition]].
==Club career== ===Lens=== Aurier played for various youth teams and academies before he was accepted to join Villepinte. Aurier then joined [[RC Lens|Lens]] in [[Ligue 1]], where this started his professional footballing career.<ref name="SergiAurier1">{{cite news|title=Sergi Aurier: le sue partite meglio di una birra d'estate|url=http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/il-volto-nuovo/cinque-milioni-per-un-terzino-full-back-difesa-attacco-forza-e-solidita-serge-aurier-le-sue-partite-meglio-di-una-birra-d-estate-294432|publisher=Tutto Mercato Web|date=14 September 2011|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> Shortly after, Aurier, who was then thirteen at the time, had to leave his friends and family as a result of joining Lens.<ref name="SergeAurier2"/> There, Aurier was assigned to the club's reserve team and at a point, was the club's captain in the reserve team.<ref name="SergeAurier2"/> In June 2009, Aurier signed his first professional contract with Lens.<ref name="SergeAurier2"/>
Aurier made his professional debut for the club in a 1–0 win over [[AS Saint-Étienne|Saint-Étienne]] on 22 December 2009.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lens leave it late|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/138433/report|publisher=Sky Sports|date=22 December 2009|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> Aurier was given another opportunity in the [[2009–10 Coupe de la Ligue#Round of 16|Round of 16 of Coupe de la Ligue]], a 2–1 loss against [[FC Lorient|Lorient]].<ref>{{cite news|title=RC Lens 1 – 2 FC Lorient|url=http://www.ligue1.com/coupeLigue/feuille_match/53523|publisher=Ligue 1|date=13 January 2010|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> He soon sustained a shoulder injury that left him out for two or three weeks.<ref>{{cite news|title=Boukari out 2 à 3 semaines|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Boukari-out-2-a-3-semaines/94806|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=11 March 2011|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> Despite this, Aurier went on to make five appearance for Lens in his first season.
Aurier's second season saw him break into the first-team, and although he went on to make 26 appearances in [[2010–11 Ligue 1|2010–11]], the club was relegated to [[Ligue 2]] after finishing second-last in the league table, at 19th. Prior to club's relegation, Aurier had signed a contract extension with the club through to 2015.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aurier un an de plus|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Aurier-un-an-de-plus/188220|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=29 March 2011|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref>
Ahead of the [[2011–12 Ligue 2|2011–12 season]], Aurier's performance soon attracted interest from clubs around England,<ref>{{cite news|title=Toulouse defender Serge Aurier would like move to England|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11820/8732822/toulouse-defender-serge-aurier-would-like-move-to-england|publisher=Sky Sports|date=24 May 2011|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> with the player considering departing Lens for a new opportunity.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aurier pense à "un départ"|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Aurier-pense-a-un-depart/209060|publisher=|work=L'Equipe|date=28 June 2011|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> However, Aurier ruled out a move abroad, implying that regardless of whether or not Aurier chose to stay or leave Lens, he would be footballing for a member of France's principal league.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aurier eyes France stay|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11820/7018449/aurier-eyes-france-stay|publisher=Sky Sports|date=4 July 2011|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> Despite this, however, Aurier began the year with Lens, making 16 appearances in the first half of the season around which time the club was facing financial issues.<ref name="Aurier442"/>
===Toulouse=== On 26 January 2012, Aurier ultimately left Lens, signing for [[Toulouse FC|Toulouse]] on a four-and-a-half-year deal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Serge Aurier à Toulouse |url=http://www.rclensois.fr/transferts/officiel-serge-aurier-a-toulouse-a14229.html |publisher=RC Len |language=French |date =26 January 2012 |accessdate = 26 January 2012|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131005003724/http://www.rclensois.fr/transferts/officiel-serge-aurier-a-toulouse-a14229.html|archivedate=5 October 2013|deadurl=no}}</ref> The move came after Toulouse's president hinted he would sign Aurier for a €1.5 million transfer fee.<ref>{{cite news|title=Toulouse veut Aurier (Lens)|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Toulouse-veut-aurier-lens/258843|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=26 January 2012|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref>
Aurier made his debut for the club two days later in a 2–1 win over [[Stade Malherbe Caen|Caen]].<ref>{{cite news|title=TOULOUSE VS. CAEN 1 – 0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/01/28/france/ligue-1/toulouse-fc/stade-malherbe-caen-calvados-basse-norma/1114927/|publisher=Soccerway|date=28 January 2012|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> He then scored his first goal for Toulouse in a 2–1 loss against [[Lille OSC|Lille]] on 1 April 2012.<ref>{{cite news|title=LOSC Lille 2 – 1 Toulouse FC|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/74662|publisher=Ligue 1|date=1 April 2012|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> Soon after, Aurier sprained his ankle which saw him miss six matches, though he was back for the last game of the season, which saw Toulouse lose 2–0 against [[AC Ajaccio|Ajaccio]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Toulouse 0 – 2 Ajaccio|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/74747|publisher=Ligue 1|date=20 May 2012|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> In his first half-season at Toulouse, he made ten appearances.
In his first full season at Toulouse, [[2012–13 Ligue 1|2012–13]], Aurier provided an assist for [[Wissam Ben Yedder]] but was sent-off in the 84th minutes for a challenge on [[Henri Bedimo]] in a 1–1 draw with [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Dramatic draw in France|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/267307/report|publisher=Sky Sports|date=10 August 2012|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> His sending off saw him suspended for three games with one-year suspended.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aurier et Dupont au pilori|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Aurier-et-dupont-au-pilori/306558|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=16 August 2012|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> After serving his two games, Aurier made his return on 1 September 2012 in a 1–1 draw against [[Stade de Reims|Reims]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Toulouse FC 1 – 1 Stade de Reims|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/75959|publisher=Ligue 1|date=1 September 2012|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> He scored his first goal of the season on 11 January 2013 in a 2–2 draw against Saint-Étienne.<ref>{{cite news|title=Mollo earns St Etienne a point|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/280692/report|publisher=Sky Sports|date=11 January 2013|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> Aurier was sidelined later on in the season after tearing a hamstring<ref>{{cite news|title=Aurier absent 10 jours|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Aurier-absent-10-jours/330137|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=28 November 2012|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> and injuring his right knee.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aurier blessé au genou droit|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Aurier-blesse-au-genou-droit/351886|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=21 February 2013|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> Despite being on the sidelines for a period of time, Aurier made 28 appearances, scoring one goal.
Ahead of the [[2013–14 Ligue 1|2013–14 season]], Aurier signed a contract extension, keeping him at Toulouse until 2018.<ref>{{cite news|title=Serge Aurier prolonge|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Serge-aurier-prolonge/383416|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=4 July 2013|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> This came after re-ignited interest in his services from clubs around Europe.<ref>{{cite news|title=Transfer news: Serge Aurier welcomes links to Everton and Marseille|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11820/8789409/transfer-news-serge-aurier-welcomes-links-to-everton-and-marseille|publisher=Sky Sports|date=23 June 2013|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> Under the management of [[Alain Casanova]], Aurier found himself playing in a 3–5–2 formation as a right-sided centre back in the three-man defence, as well as a wing-back at times.<ref name="Aurier442">{{cite news|title=Everything you need to know about... Serge Aurier|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/everything-you-need-know-about-serge-aurier|publisher=FourFourTwo|date=4 June 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> He went on to play an attacking role by assisting two goals in two different matches by the end of September. Aurier then scored his first goal of the season in a 2–1 loss against [[Evian Thonon Gaillard F.C.|Evian]] on 2 November 2013.<ref>{{cite news|title=Evian Thonon Gaillard 2 – 1 Toulouse FC|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/77624|publisher=Ligue 1|date=2 November 2013|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> His second goal of the season came on 2 February 2014 in a 2–2 draw against [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Toulouse sait embêter l'OM|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Toulouse-sait-embeter-l-om/437755|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=2 February 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> His third goal of the season came on 15 February 2014 in a 3–1 win over Lorient.<ref>{{cite news|title=FC Lorient 1 – 3 Toulouse FC|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/77755|publisher=Ligue 1|date=15 February 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> He went on to score two goals in two games against Reims<ref>{{cite news|title=Toulouse FC 3 – 2 Stade de Reims|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/77791|publisher=Ligue 1|date=8 March 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> and [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Stade Rennais FC 2 – 3 Toulouse FC|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/77801|publisher=Ligue 1|date=15 March 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> His sixth goal of the season came on 5 April 2014 in a 2–1 loss against Lille.<ref>{{cite news|title=Toulouse FC 1 – 2 LOSC Lille|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/77831|publisher=Ligue 1|date=5 April 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> Aurier went on to make 34 appearances, scoring six times. At the end of the 2013–14 season, Aurier was shortlisted for the [[Trophées UNFP du football#Player of the Year|Ligue 1 Player of the Year]] for the first time in his career.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://sport24.lefigaro.fr/football/ligue-1/actualites/trophees-unfp-le-psg-truste-les-nominations-692478|title=Trophées UNFP : Le PSG truste les nominations|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=1 May 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> He was also named as the second-best player African player in Ligue 1.<ref>{{cite news|title=Enyeama meilleur joueur africain de L1 devant Aurier et Bedimo|url=http://www.foot01.com/ligue1/enyeama-meilleur-joueur-africain-de-l1-devant-aurier-et-bedimo,143943|publisher=Foot 01|language=French|date=12 May 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref>
After an impressive display at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] for the Ivory Coast, Aurier was again linked with a move away from Toulouse.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aurier convoité par Monaco|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Aurier-convoite-par-monaco/480130|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=5 July 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Trois clubs anglais pour Aurier|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Trois-clubs-anglais-pour-aurier/475943|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=21 June 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> In an interview, Aurier stated that his dream move would be to English club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] of the [[Premier League]] and claimed that he could not turn them down if they made an offer for him.<ref>{{cite news|title=Transfer News: Toulouse defender Serge Aurier interested in move to Arsenal|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11820/9256882/transfer-news-toulouse-defender-serge-aurier-interested-in-move-to-arsenal|publisher=Sky Sports|date=9 April 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Transfer news: Toulouse's Serge Aurier would welcome summer move to Arsenal|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11820/9320434/transfer-news-toulouses-serge-aurier-would-welcome-summer-move-to-arsenal|publisher=Sky Sports|date=21 May 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref>
===Paris Saint-Germain=== On 23 July 2014, Aurier joined [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] on a season-long loan with an option for the Parisian club to purchase outright.<ref>{{cite web|title=Serge Aurier joins Paris Saint-Germain|url=http://www.psg.fr/en/News/003001/Article/67561/Serge-Aurier-joins-Paris-Saint-Germain|publisher=Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|accessdate=24 July 2014|date=23 July 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140725055318/http://www.psg.fr/en/News/003001/Article/67561/Serge-Aurier-joins-Paris-Saint-Germain|archivedate=25 July 2014|deadurl=no}}</ref> His move to PSG was believed to be as a replacement for incumbent right back [[Christophe Jallet]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Jallet proche de Lyon|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Jallet-proche-de-lyon/482712|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=15 July 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> Upon moving to PSG, Aurier stated he had no concern over his first-team chances, despite facing competition from [[Gregory van der Wiel]], who also plays primarily as a right back.<ref>{{cite news|title=Je découvre des compétiteurs|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Aurier-je-decouvre-des-competiteurs/490168|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=14 August 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref>
Aurier made his PSG debut in the [[2014–15 Ligue 1]], coming on as a substitute for Van der Wiel in a 2–0 win over [[SC Bastia|Bastia]] on 16 August 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Paris Saint-Germain 2 – 1 SC Bastia|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/78796|publisher=Ligue 1|date=16 August 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> He scored his first goal for PSG in the [[2014–15 Coupe de la Ligue#Round of 16|Round of 16 of Coupe de la Ligue]] in a 3–1 victory over Ajaccio.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ajaccio 1–3 Paris Saint-Germain |url= http://www.ligue1.com/coupeLigue/feuille_match/79732 |publisher=Ligue 1 |date=17 December 2014 |accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> In the first half of the season, Aurier was unable to establish himself in the first team due to his own injury concerns and international commitments.<ref>{{cite news|title=Côte d'Ivoire : Aurier blessé|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Aurier-s-est-blesse/506033|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=10 November 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Pastore très incertain contre Caen|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Pastore-incertain-contre-caen/536033|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=13 February 2015|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> Aurier played his first PSG match in one month – lasting the entire 90 minutes – in a 2–2 draw against Caen;<ref>{{cite news|title=Paris Saint-Germain 2 – 2 SM Caen|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31458484|publisher=BBC Sport|date=14 February 2015|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> his performance was later praised after the match.<ref>{{cite news|title=Le PSG rend hommage à Aurier|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Hommage-a-aurier/536276|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=14 February 2015|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> During the match, however, he injured himself and was not substituted out, as manager [[Laurent Blanc]] had previously used all three of his substitutions earlier in the match.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aurier sort sur une civière|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Aurier-sort-sur-une-civiere/536330|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=14 February 2015|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> Whilst on the sidelines in PSG's [[UEFA Champions League]] match against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], Aurier found himself in hot water with [[UEFA]] after criticizing [[Björn Kuipers]]' refereeing decision and calling him a "dirty son of a bitch" in a video posted on Facebook. Though Aurier later apologised for his actions,<ref>{{cite news|title=PSG defender Serge Aurier apologises for comments after Chelsea clash|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11820/9763748/serge-aurier-apologises-for-comments-about-referee-after-champions-league-clash-with-chelsea|publisher=Sky Sports|date=17 March 2015|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> UEFA nonetheless suspended him for three matches.<ref>{{cite news|title=Paris St-Germain defender Serge Aurier banned for insulting referee|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31973132|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 March 2015|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> Despite this, Aurier went on to make nineteen appearance for the club
[[File:PSG-Shakhter15 (5).jpg|thumb|upright|Aurier in action in a Champions League match away to [[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]] in October 2015]] On 29 April 2015, Aurier secured a permanent move to PSG, signing a four-year contract.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11095/9828139/serge-aurier-signs-for-psg-on-four-year-deal|title=Serge Aurier signs for PSG on four-year deal|date=29 April 2015|accessdate=30 April 2015|publisher=SkySports}}</ref> Aurier's first game after signing for the club on a permanent basis came in the [[2015 Trophée des Champions|Trophée des Champions]] against [[Olympique Lyonnais|Lyon]], where he scored his first PSG goal and helped the club win 2–0.<ref>{{cite news|title=Paris, trop fort pour Lyon, remporte le Trophée des Champions (2–0)|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Paris-trop-fort-pour-lyon-remporte-le-trophee-des-champions-2-0/578568|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=2 August 2015|accessdate=28 February 2016}}</ref> Aurier found himself competing with Van der Wiel over a right position under the management of Blanc. Aurier scored his first league goal for PSG goal on 26 September 2015 in a 4–1 win over [[FC Nantes|Nantes]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Le PSG s'impose largement à Nantes|url=http://sport24.lefigaro.fr/football/ligue-1/fil-info/le-psg-s-impose-largement-a-nantes-771844|publisher=Le Figaro|language=French|date=26 September 2015|accessdate=28 February 2016}}</ref> For his performance, Aurier was named Team of the Week by [[L'Equipe]].<ref>{{cite news|title=L'équipe type de la 8e journée de Ligue 1|url=http://sport24.lefigaro.fr/football/ligue-1/actualites/l-equipe-type-de-la-8e-journee-de-ligue-1-772110|publisher=Le Figaro|language=French|date=28 September 2015|accessdate=28 February 2016}}</ref> Four days later, Aurier scored in the Champions League group stage in a 3–0 win over [[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]].<ref>{{cite news|title=A Le PSG enchaîne contre le Chakhtior Donetsk (3–0)|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Le-psg-enchaine-contre-le-chakhtior-donetsk-3-0/595133|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=30 September 2015|accessdate=28 February 2016}}</ref> Aurier scored against Lyon for the second time in the season three months later on 13 December 2015, helping his team to a 5–1 victory.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ligue 1 : Le PSG impitoyable avec Lyon|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ligue-1-le-psg-impitoyable-avec-lyon/616415|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=13 December 2015|accessdate=28 February 2016}}</ref>
Aurier was suspended indefinitely on 14 February 2016 for calling teammate [[Ángel Di María]] a "clown" and calling [[Laurent Blanc]] a "''fiotte''" (a homophobic slur) during a question-and-answer session on [[Periscope (app)|Periscope]] in which he also criticised supposed favouritism towards striker [[Zlatan Ibrahimović]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Serge Aurier: Paris St-Germain suspend defender indefinitely |url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35573547 |accessdate=14 February 2016|publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 February 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=PSG suspend Serge Aurier for comments on Laurent Blanc and team-mates |URL= https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/feb/14/paris-saint-germain-suspend-serge-aurier-comments-laurent-blanc-champions-league-chelsea |accessdate=14 February 2016 |publisher=The Guardian |date=14 February 2016}}</ref> Following his suspension, PSG ordered Aurier to train with their [[Paris Saint-Germain Academy|reserve side]] from 29 February until 20 March.<ref name="Serge Aurier: Paris St-Germain right-back to train with reserves">{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35674511 | title=Serge Aurier: Paris St-Germain right-back to train with reserves | publisher=BBC Sport | date=26 February 2016 | accessdate=26 February 2016}}</ref>
===Tottenham Hotspur=== On 31 August 2017, Aurier signed for [[Premier League]] club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] for a fee in the region of £23 million.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41081740 |title=Serge Aurier: Tottenham sign Paris St-Germain full-back for £23m |publisher=BBC Sport |author=Simon Stone |date=31 August 2017 |accessdate=31 August 2017 }}</ref> Aurier made his debut on 13 September in a 3–1 win over [[Borussia Dortmund]] at [[Wembley Stadium]] in the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/09/13/serge-aurier-no-dummy-debut-strength-depth-suggests-spurs-can/ |title=Serge Aurier no dummy on debut as strength in depth suggests Spurs can make Champions League impact|first=Matt|last= Law |work=The Daily Telegraph|date=13 September 2017 }}</ref> Ten days later, Aurier made his full league debut at [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], but he was sent off upon receiving a second yellow card as Tottenham held on for a 3–2 victory.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Chowdhury|first1=Saj|title=West Ham United 2–3 Tottenham Hotspur|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41290321|accessdate=23 September 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 September 2017}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club in a 2–0 home win against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] on 13 December 2017.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/12/13/tottenham-2-brighton-0-serge-auriers-fluke-helps-send-spurs/ |title=Tottenham 2 Brighton 0: Serge Aurier's fluke helps send Spurs back into top four|first= Matt |last=Law|work= The Daily Telegraph |date=13 December 2017}}</ref> Aurier competed for the right-back spot with [[Kieran Trippier]] throughout the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tottenham Hotspur news: Serge Aurier ready for battle with World Cup star Kieran Trippier for right-back role |url=https://talksport.com/football/403634/tottenham-hotspur-serge-aurier-battle-kieran-trippier/ |accessdate=12 August 2018 |publisher=Talksport |date=25 July 2018}}</ref>
In his second season in London, Aurier was competing for his place not only against Trippier but also with young Englishman [[Kyle Walker-Peters]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Stanley |first1=Anton |title=Tottenham Hotspur news: Serge Aurier ready for ‘good fight’ as he attempts to claim starting role |url=https://talksport.com/football/426492/tottenham-hotspur-news-serge-aurier-good-fight-spurs-kieran-trippier/ |accessdate=30 January 2019 |publisher=Talksport |date=26 September 2018}}</ref> On 4 January 2019, in an FA Cup third round match away to [[EFL League Two]] club [[Tranmere Rovers]], he scored twice in a 7–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tranmere Rovers 0 Tottenham 7: Llorente hat-trick crowns Spurs rout|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/tranmere-rovers-0-tottenham-7-llorente-hat-trick-crowns-spurs-rout |accessdate=30 January 2019 |work=FourFourTwo |date=4 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== Despite having lived in France for over 14 years, Aurier does not hold a French passport,<ref name="SergeAurier1">{{cite news|title=PSG: Aurier, des bleus a l'ame|url=http://www.leparisien.fr/sports/aurier-des-bleus-a-l-ame-19-10-2016-6225333.php|publisher=Le Parisien Web|date=19 October 2016|accessdate=16 August 2017}}</ref> and had originally turned down the chance to play for the [[Ivory Coast national football team|Ivory Coast]].<ref name="SergeAurier3">{{cite news |title=World Cup 2014: Ivory Coast profile – Serge Aurier |url= https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/jun/01/world-cup-2014-ivory-coast-serge-aurier |publisher=The Guardian |date=1 June 2014 |accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lensois.com/breve-28195-cote-d-ivoire-ou-france-aurier-hesite.html |title=Cote d'Ivoire ou France ? Aurier hésite |publisher=Lensois.com |date=12 March 2010 |accessdate=7 April 2015 |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100515040521/http://www.lensois.com/breve-28195-cote-d-ivoire-ou-france-aurier-hesite.html |archivedate=15 May 2010 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> However, he was called up by manager [[Sabri Lamouchi]] in April 2013,<ref>{{cite news |title=Didier Drogba left out of Ivory Coast squad again |url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22566960 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 May 2013 |accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> and eventually played his first match for his homeland against the [[Gambia national football team|Gambia]] on 8 June that year.<ref>{{cite news |url= https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/africa/matches/round=258334/match=300180955/index.html |title=Gambia 0–3 Ivory Coast |date=8 June 2013 |accessdate=15 June 2014 |publisher=FIFA.com}}</ref>
Aurier was included in Ivory Coast's 23-man squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014 World Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fif-ci.com/~v2/?q=article/mondial-2014-11|title=Les 23 Eléphants pour le Brésil|date=1 June 2014|accessdate=1 June 2014|publisher=Ivorian Football Federation|language=French}}</ref> In the first group match, against [[Japan national football team|Japan]], he provided assists for both [[Wilfried Bony]] and [[Gervinho]] in a 2–1 win.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/305826/report|title=World Cup: Ivory Coast hit back to see off Japan|date=15 June 2014|accessdate=15 June 2014|publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref>
On 29 December 2014, Aurier was called up for the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations|Africa Cup of Nations]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Les 23 d'Hervé Renard|url=http://www.fedivoir.com/fifci/?q=article/can-2015-1|language=French|publisher=[[Ivorian Football Federation|fedivoir.com]]|date=29 December 2014|accessdate=29 December 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141229212511/http://www.fedivoir.com/fifci/?q=article%2Fcan-2015-1|archivedate=29 December 2014}}</ref> He played six matches and impressed with his displays in the tournament, particularly in the final.<ref>{{cite news|title=Bony a spol. slaví! Sloni vyhráli na penalty a jsou mistry Afriky|url=http://isport.blesk.cz/clanek/fotbal-reprezentace/227442/bony-a-spol-slavi-sloni-vyhrali-na-penalty-a-jsou-mistry-afriky.html|publisher=iSport.cz|language=Czech|date=8 February 2015|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> He was shortlisted for the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations#Awards|CAF Team of the Tournament]].<ref>{{cite news|title=ORANGE AFCON 2015 AWARDS AND BEST XI|url=http://www.cafonline.com/en-US/NewsCenter/News/NewsDetails?id=N5LLNBRtUVsPZJSOkHVjrw%3D%3D|publisher=CAF Online|date=12 February 2015|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref>
In October 2016, during a [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification|World Cup Qualifier]] against [[Mali national football team|Mali]], Aurier rushed to the aid of Mali midfielder, [[Moussa Doumbia (footballer, born 1994)|Moussa Doumbia]], who had suffered an [[epilepsy|epileptic fit]] to prevent him from swallowing his tongue. Despite his good deed, Aurier later drew criticism for celebrating Ivory Coast's second goal with a 'slit throat' gesture.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2914/champions-league/2016/10/19/28619692/angel-and-demon-life-saver-aurier-a-magnet-for-bad-publicity?ICID=HP_BN_6|last=Bairner|first=Robin|title=Angel and demon: Life-saver Aurier a magnet for bad publicity|website=Goal|date=19 October 2016|accessdate=19 October 2016}}</ref>
Aurier scored his first goal for the Elephants on 11 January 2017, in a 3–0 friendly win over Uganda in [[Abu Dhabi]], after earlier assisting [[Jonathan Kodjia]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Oludare|first1=Shina|title=CÔTE D'IVOIRE SEND AFCON WARNING WITH VICTORY OVER UGANDA|url=http://www.goal.com/en-ie/news/cote-divoire/1p1nzrgxgd3g5126d2br25nqoj|accessdate=9 September 2017|publisher=Goal.com|date=11 January 2017}}</ref>
==Personal life== Born in [[Ouragahio]], Ivory Coast, Aurier moved to France at a young age after his parents wanted their children to have a better life.<ref name="SergeAurier2">{{cite news|title=Prospect: Serge Aurier|url=http://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2014/prospect-serge-aurier-2/|publisher=Get French Football News|date=23 March 2014|accessdate=7 April 2015}}</ref> He is a Muslim.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://ripostelaique.com/lorient-psg-le-musulman-aurier-a-sauve-la-soiree-de-lennui.html|title=Lorient-PSG : le musulman Aurier a sauvé la soirée de l’ennui !|date=13 March 2017|work=Riposte Laïque|access-date=27 October 2018|language=fr-FR}}</ref> He was passionate about football while growing up.<ref name="SergeAurier2"/> Aurier's younger brother, Christopher, plays for his former club Lens.<ref>{{cite web|title=RC Lens – Serge Aurier à ne pas confondre avec Christopher|url=http://www.espoirsdufootball.com/rc-lens-serge-aurier-a-ne-pas-confondre-avec-christopher-9459|publisher=Espoirs du Football|language=French|date=22 December 2009}}</ref>
On 26 September 2016, Aurier was found guilty of assaulting a police officer outside a nightclub in Paris. He was sentenced to two months in prison, but remained at liberty pending an appeal.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-37470381|title=Paris St-Germain's Serge Aurier given two-month jail term|date=26 September 2016|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Although UK authorities granted Aurier a visa in October 2016, it was revoked on 16 November due to his conviction, and as a result, he missed the [[UEFA Champions League]] match against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in London that month.<ref>{{cite news|title=Serge Aurier: PSG defender refused entry to UK before Arsenal game|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38069036|publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 November 2016|accessdate=1 August 2017}}</ref>
