'''Lucas Rodrigues Moura da Silva''' (born 13 August 1992), known as '''Lucas Moura''' ({{IPA-pt|ˈlukas ˈmowɾɐ|br}})<ref>{{cite web|url=https://forvo.com/word/lucas_moura/|title=Lucas Moura pronunciation: How to pronounce Lucas Moura in Portuguese|first=Forvo|last=Team|website=Forvo.com}}</ref> or simply '''Lucas''', is a Brazilian professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[right winger (association football)|right winger]] for English club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and the [[Brazil national football team|Brazil national team]].
==Club career== ===São Paulo=== Lucas joined [[São Paulo FC]] in 2005 after playing for the youth teams of [[Clube Atlético Juventus]] and [[Sport Club Corinthians Paulista|Corinthians]] and was known as '''Marcelinho''' since he played for a [[Marcelinho Carioca]] football school as a child and also had physical resemblance with the former footballer.<ref>http://esporte.uol.com.br/futebol/ultimas-noticias/2015/03/05/fifa-decide-que-sao-paulo-nao-precisa-pagar-corinthians-por-lucas.htm</ref> Having had prominence at youth level, he was promoted to play professionally by Milton Cruz. Lucas made his debut with the São Paulo first-team in 2010, scoring 4 goals and providing four assists in 25 appearances. In the same year, he stated his desire to be known for his given name instead of a nickname to "make his own history in football without comparisons".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://esportes.estadao.com.br/noticias/futebol,sao-paulino-marcelinho-quer-ser-chamado-de-lucas,610386|title=São-paulino Marcelinho quer ser chamado de Lucas – Esportes – Estadão|publisher=Estadao.com.br}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://globoesporte.globo.com/futebol/brasileirao-serie-a/noticia/2010/09/ex-marcelinho-lucas-brilha-e-desenha-vitoria-do-sao-paulo-no-choque-rei.html|title=Ex-Marcelinho, Lucas brilha e desenha vitória do São Paulo no 'Choque-Rei'|publisher=Globo.com}}</ref> In 2011, Lucas scored nine goals and provided four assists in 28 appearances in the [[Campeonato Brasileiro Série A|Campeonato Brasileiro]] and 13 goals and eight assists in all competitions.
===Paris Saint-Germain=== During the summer of 2012, both [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and [[Inter Milan|Internazionale]] were reported to be interested in signing Lucas.<ref>{{cite web|title=United crank up £30m Moura bid as Brazil ace expresses doubt over Sao Paulo future|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2170869/Lucas-Moura-open-Manchester-United-switch.html|work=Mail Online|date= 9 July 2012 |accessdate=20 September 2012}}</ref> On 8 August 2012, [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] won the battle and announced the player would be moving to the club in January 2013. He would be the club's most expensive signing.<ref>{{cite web|title=PSG agree Moura deal|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11820/7974057/PSG-agree-Moura-deal|publisher=Sky Sports|date= 8 August 2012 |accessdate=8 August 2012}}</ref> The transfer fee was reported to be in the region of €45 million (£38 million).<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/manchester-united-target-lucas-moura-joins-psg-in-45m-deal-8025959.html |title=Manchester United 'target' Lucas Moura joins PSG in €45m deal |date=9 August 2012 |accessdate=2 September 2014 |work=The Independent}}</ref> It was announced that Lucas would wear the No. 29 shirt for the remainder of the season.
On 11 January 2013, Moura made his debut against [[AC Ajaccio]], in a match that ended as a 0–0 draw. He also played in the [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] away victory over [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] on 12 February, assisting a goal in the process.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2013/matches/round=2000348/match=2009586/postmatch/report/index.html#psg+prevail+spain |title=Rami strike halves PSG advantage |work=UEFA |date=12 February 2013 |accessdate=29 October 2014 }}</ref> On 13 September 2013, Moura scored his first goal for PSG in a 2–0 [[2013–14 Ligue 1|league]] victory over Bordeaux.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/match/bordeaux-vs-psg/1479088/report |title=Bordeaux 0–2 Paris Saint-Germain: Lucas nets first goal for champions |work=Goal.com |date=13 September 2013 |accessdate=29 October 2014 }}</ref>
For the [[2014–15 Paris Saint-Germain F.C. season|2014–15 season]], following [[Jérémy Ménez]]'s transfer to [[A.C. Milan]], Lucas was handed the No. 7 shirt – the same number he wore while playing for [[São Paulo FC|São Paulo]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.psgcommunity.fr/transfert-mercato-psg/psg-lucas-moura-sempare-du-numero-7-jeremy-menez/26108 |title=PSG : Lucas Moura s’empare du numéro 7 de Jérémy Ménez |work=PSG Community |date=11 June 2014 |accessdate=29 October 2014 }}</ref> Moura made his season debut for PSG in their 2–0 [[2014 Trophée des Champions|Trophée des Champions]] victory over [[2013–14 Coupe de France|Coupe de France]] winners [[EA Guingamp]] on 2 August 2014 at the [[Workers Stadium]] in [[Beijing]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/match/psg-vs-guingamp/1681357/report |title=Paris Saint-Germain 2–0 Guingamp: Ibrahimovic double secures Super Cup spoils |work=Goal.com |date=2 August 2014 |accessdate=29 October 2014 }}</ref>
He scored his first goal of the [[2014–15 Ligue 1]] campaign on 16 August, volleying in a [[Gregory van der Wiel]] cross as PSG defeated [[SC Bastia|Bastia]] 2–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/match/psg-vs-bastia/1686731/report |title=Paris Saint-Germain 2–0 Bastia: Ibrahimovic injured but Cavani clinches victory |work=Goal.com |date=16 August 2014 |accessdate=29 October 2014 }}</ref> On 5 October, Moura scored the opening goal in a match that finished 1–1 against title rivals [[AS Monaco|Monaco]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/oct/05/psg-monaco-ligue-1-match-report |title=Monaco's Anthony Martial thwarts PSG in battle of Ligue 1 big spenders |work=The Guardian |date=5 October 2014 |accessdate=29 October 2014 }}</ref> With his two goals in PSG's 3–0 victory over [[Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]] on 25 October, Lucas equalled his league tally from the previous season.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29756076 |title=Brazilian Lucas Moura scored two penalties as Paris St-Germain beat Bordeaux to maintain their unbeaten start to the season in a game where both sides had a player sent off. |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 October 2014 |accessdate=29 October 2014 }}</ref>
On 7 August 2015, Lucas scored the first goal of the [[2015–16 Ligue 1]] season in PSG's 1–0 defeat of [[Lille OSC]] at the [[Stade Pierre-Mauroy]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12040/9940780/lille-0-1-psg-lucas-moura-hands-10-man-champions-winning-start|title=Lille 0–1 PSG: Lucas Moura hands 10-man champions winning start|date=7 August 2015|work=BSkyB}}</ref>
On 15 October 2016, Lucas scored PSG's first goal in the 13th minute in a 2–1 away win against [[AS Nancy]] in a Ligue 1 match with a curling free-kick from the left which nobody got a touch to; that was his fifth league goal of the [[2016–17 Ligue 1]] season.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/article/cavani-strikes-again-as-psg-go-second.htm|title=Cavani strikes again as PSG go second|publisher=www.ligue1.com|date=15 October 2016}}</ref> For the [[2017–18 Ligue 1]] season, he appeared only as substitute six times for the club, and left in January 2018.<ref name="BBC Jan 2018">{{cite news |url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42886758 |title=Lucas Moura: Tottenham sign PSG forward for fee in region of £25m |work=BBC }}</ref>
===Tottenham Hotspur=== On 31 January 2018, Lucas signed a contract with [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] until 2023 for a transfer fee of around £25 million.<ref name="BBC Jan 2018"/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/moura-move-agreed-310118/|title=Moura move agreed|publisher=Tottenham Hotspur Football Club |work=tottenhamhotspur.com|date=31 January 2018}}</ref> He made his debut for Tottenham in the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League]] match against [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] on 13 February 2018, coming on as a late substitute in the match that ended in a 2–2 draw.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://talksport.com/football/juventus-2-2-tottenham-christian-eriksen-star-spurs-stun-old-lady-champions-league-thriller |title=Juventus 2-2 Tottenham: Christian Eriksen the star as Spurs stun Old Lady in Champions League thriller in Turin | date=13 February 2018 |publisher=talkSPORT }}</ref> He made his first start as well as scoring his first goal for the club in the [[2017–18 FA Cup|FA Cup]] tie against [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] on 18 February 2018 that also finished 2–2.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/tottenham-analysis-lack-of-leaders-a-concern-by-lucas-moura-impresses-in-fa-cup-draw-a3769576.html |title=Tottenham analysis: Lack of leaders a concern but Lucas Moura impresses in FA Cup draw |author=Tom Collomosse |work=The Evening Standard |date=18 February 2018 |accessdate=18 February 2018}}</ref>
In the [[2018–19 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2018–19 season]], Lucas scored his first Premier League goal on 18 August 2018 in Spurs' 3–1 win over [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/tottenham-new-stadium-delays-no-problem-spurs-look-at-home-at-wembley-as-lucas-moura-begins-to-a3914816.html|title=Tottenham analysis: Lack of leaders a concern but Lucas Moura impresses in FA Cup draw |author=Dan Kilpatrick |work=The Evening Standard |date=18 February 2018 |accessdate=18 February 2018}}</ref> In the following match on 27 August 2018, Lucas scored a brace against Manchester United as Tottenham won 3–0 in only their third away win at Old Trafford in 27 games.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/aug/27/manchester-united-tottenham-hotspur-premier-league-match-report |title=Lucas Moura double for Spurs deepens gloom at Manchester United |first=Daniel |last=Taylor |date=27 August 2018 |work=The Guardian |accessdate=28 August 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://talksport.com/football/415729/manchester-united-tottenham-hotspur-jose-mourinho-harry-kane-lucas-moura/ |title=Manchester United 0-3 Tottenham Hotspur: Visitors end Old Trafford hoodoo in style to pile pressure on José Mourinho |first=Sean |last=O'Brien|date=27 August 2018|work=Talk Sport|accessdate=28 August 2018}}</ref> He scored his first [[2018–19 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] goal for Spurs in the group round match against [[PSV Eindhoven]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45907600 |title=PSV Eindhoven 2 – 2 Tottenham Hotspur |first=Matt|last= Bullin|work=BBC Sport }}</ref> In the away match against [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] at [[Camp Nou]], Lucas scored a late equaliser after Barcelona took an early lead in the game. The game ended 1–1, which sent Tottenham through into the knockout stage together with Barcelona.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/dec/11/barcelona-tottenham-champions-league-match-report |title=Lucas Moura’s late goal takes Spurs through to last 16 in Barça draw |first=David|last=Hytner |work=The Guardian |date=11 December 2018 }}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Lucas e Neymar 01.jpg|thumb|Lucas with his international teammate [[Neymar]] in 2012]] Lucas was a frequent member of [[Brazil national under-20 football team|Brazil's Under-20]] international side. In February 2011, Lucas was involved for [[Brazil national under-20 football team|Brazil]] in the [[South American Youth Championship|Under-20 South American Championship]] where he scored a hat-trick in a 6–0 victory over [[Uruguay national under-20 football team|Uruguay]] in the final. Lucas made his senior international debut for [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] in friendly match against [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] on 27 March 2011. On 28 September 2011, Lucas scored his first senior international goal for Brazil against [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]].
===2011 Copa América=== Lucas was named in [[Mano Menezes|Mano Menezes']] squad for the [[2011 Copa América]] in Argentina. Lucas appeared in the group stage matches against [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay]], [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]] and [[Venezuela national football team|Venezuela]] as a second-half substitute on all occasions. Lucas once again featured as a substitute in Brazil's [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]] defeat to [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay]] in the quarter-finals which eliminated Brazil from the competition.
===2012 Olympics=== Lucas was selected to compete for the [[Brazil Olympic football team]] in the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Summer Olympics]] in London along with club teammates [[Casemiro]] and [[Bruno Uvini]]. He appeared in three matches as a substitute, including the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament – Knockout stage#Gold medal match|Gold medal match]] with [[Mexico national under-23 football team|Mexico]], and started in the 3–0 [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament – Group C|group stage]] victory over [[New Zealand national under-23 football team|New Zealand]]. Lucas was left out of the FIFA 2014 Brazilian squad by coach [[Luiz Felipe Scolari]].
==Style of play== A quick and mobile [[Forward (association football)#Winger|winger]], who is also powerful, creative, and technically gifted,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/psg-winger-lucas-eager-face-idol-messi#:xu4HD24Nf9qdcA|title=PSG winger Lucas eager to face 'idol' Messi|work=Four Four Two|date=13 April 2015|accessdate=4 November 2015}}</ref> Lucas Moura is known for his explosive acceleration, agility, and pace on the ball, as well as his excellent [[Dribbling#Association football|dribbling]] skills, in particular his use of [[Football skills|trickery]] and [[Dummy (football)|feints]], which makes him a dangerous offensive threat.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/club/paris-saint-germain/160/blog/post/2638008/psg-lucas-moura-must-harness-talent-to-become-star|title=Can PSG's Lucas Moura harness his talent to become game's next big star?|publisher=ESPN FC|author1=Simon Kuper|date=29 September 2015|accessdate=4 November 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/club/paris-saint-germain/160/blog/post/2480683/lucas-moura-impressive-psg-season-earns-him-new-contract|title=Lucas' most impressive season since PSG arrival earns him new contract|publisher=ESPN FC|author1=Jonathan Johnson|date=5 June 2015|accessdate=4 November 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/performance/skills/lucas-moura-dribble-brazilian-way#:wdj8JazeCXfliA|title=Lucas Moura: Dribble the Brazilian way|work=Four Four Two|accessdate=4 November 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://metro.co.uk/2012/07/11/manchester-united-face-competition-from-inter-milan-for-lucas-moura-3374036/|title=Manchester United face competition from Inter Milan for Lucas Moura|work=Metro|author1=Jamie Sanderson|date=11 July 2012|accessdate=4 November 2015}}</ref> A versatile player, he is also capable of playing in several positions, and has also been deployed as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/apr/01/lucas-moura-psg-chelsea-champions-league|title=Lucas Moura interview: 'PSG are not the underdogs against Chelsea'|work=The Guardian|author1=Fernando Duarte|date=1 April 2014|accessdate=4 November 2015}}</ref> in [[Midfielder|midfield]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11820/9015769/transfer-news-lucas-moura-very-happy-to-be-playing-for-paris-saint-germain|title=Transfer news: Lucas Moura "very happy" to be playing for Paris Saint-Germain|publisher=Sky Sports|date=8 November 2013|accessdate=4 November 2015}}</ref> or as an [[attacking midfielder]] behind the strikers.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/jul/23/football-transfer-rumours-manchester-united|title=Football transfer rumours: Lucas Moura to Manchester United?|work=The Guardian|author1=Georgina Turner|date=23 July 2012|accessdate=4 November 2015}}</ref>
==Political views== Moura endorsed the [[Far-right politics|far-right]] politician [[Jair Bolsonaro]] during his successful campaign in the [[2018 Brazilian general election]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Law |first1=Joshua |title=Lucas Moura and the Brazilian football stars giving their backing to Jair Bolsonaro |url=https://www.givemesport.com/1398107-lucas-moura-and-the-brazilian-football-stars-giving-their-backing-to-jair-bolsonaro |accessdate=23 January 2019 |work=GiveMeSport}}</ref>

==Honours== [[File:Neymar, Lucas Moura, Dilma Rousseff, Ganso.jpg|right|thumb|Lucas (second from left), [[Neymar]] (extreme left) and [[Paulo Henrique Ganso|Ganso]] (extreme right) with [[Dilma Rousseff]] after the draw for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].]]

(football club)|NEC]] | youthyears4 = 2009–2013 | youthclubs4 = [[Feyenoord]] | years1 = 2013–2015 | clubs1 = [[Almere City FC|Almere City]] | caps1 = 69 | goals1 = 29 | years2 = 2015–2016 | clubs2 = [[AZ Alkmaar|AZ]] | caps2 = 34 | goals2 = 27 | years3 = 2016– | clubs3 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | caps3 = 28 | goals3 = 2 | years4 = 2017–2018 | clubs4 = → [[Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)|Fenerbahçe]] (loan) | caps4 = 16 | goals4 = 4 | nationalyears1 = 2008–2009 | nationalteam1 = Netherlands U15 | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2009 | nationalteam2 = Netherlands U16 | nationalcaps2 = 6 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | nationalyears3 = 2011 | nationalteam3 = Netherlands U18 | nationalcaps3 = 1 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2014 | nationalteam4 = [[Netherlands national under-20 football team|Netherlands U20]] | nationalcaps4 = 2 | nationalgoals4 = 2 | nationalyears5 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam5 = [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 10 | nationalgoals5 = 8 | nationalyears6 = 2016– | nationalteam6 = [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] | nationalcaps6 = 17 | nationalgoals6 = 7 | club-update = 09:19, 17 May 2018 (UTC) | ntupdate = 14 November 2017 (UTC) }}
'''Vincent Petrus Anna Sebastiaan Janssen''' (born 15 June 1994) is a Dutch professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|striker]] for English club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands national team]]. He was awarded the 2016 [[Dutch Footballer of the Year#Dutch Football Talent of the Year .28Young player.29|Johan Cruyff Trophy]], the Dutch "Talent of the Year" award.
==Club career== ===Early career=== Janssen formerly played in [[N.E.C. (football club)|NEC]] and [[Feyenoord]] youth teams, winning the U19s national title with Feyenoord in 2013.<ref>{{cite news|last1=May|first1=Sam|title=The rise of Vincent Janssen: From Almere City to Oranje in 12 months|url=http://www.football-oranje.com/rise-vincent-janssen/|accessdate=2 July 2016|work=Football Oranje|date=18 March 2016}}</ref>
After being released by Feyenoord, he joined [[Eerste Divisie]] team [[Almere City FC|Almere City]] in 2013.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Vos|first1=Tim|title=Van Almere naar Wembley: een kleine stap voor Janssen|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/van-almere-naar-wembley-een-kleine-stap-voor-janssen.htm|accessdate=2 July 2016|work=Voetbal International|date=30 March 2016|language=Dutch}}</ref><ref name="skysports">{{cite news|last1=Kabelu|first1=Beya|title=Who is Vincent Janssen? We profile Tottenham's potential new signing|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11675/10307971/who-is-vincent-janssen-we-profile-tottenhams-potential-new-signing|accessdate=2 July 2016|work=Sky Sports|date=9 June 2016}}</ref> He made his debut for Almere on 3 August 2013 in a 3–2 home defeat against [[FC Volendam|Volendam]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Van Almere naar White Hart Lane in veertien maanden |trans-title=From Almere to White Hart Lane in fourteen months|url=http://nos.nl/artikel/2117169-van-almere-naar-white-hart-lane-in-veertien-maanden.html|accessdate=13 July 2016|work=NOS.nl|date=12 July 2016|language=Dutch}}</ref> After netting ten goals in the [[2013–14 Eerste Divisie|2013–14 season]], he reached 19 goals the [[2014–15 Eerste Divisie|following season]].<ref name="espnfc">{{cite news|last1=Yokhin|first1=Michael|title=Alkmaar's Vincent Janssen drawing Ruud van Nistelrooy comparisons|url=http://www.espnfc.com/dutch-eredivisie/11/blog/post/2813252/vincent-janssen-drawing-ruud-van-nistelrooy-comparisons|accessdate=2 July 2016|work=ESPN FC|date=23 February 2016}}</ref> He scored 32 goals in 74 appearances in all competitions for Almere.<ref name="skysports"/>
===AZ=== After two seasons with Almere, Janssen moved to [[Eredivisie]] side [[AZ Alkmaar|AZ]] in 2015, signing a contract with the club until 2019.<ref>{{cite news|title=AZ legt Coutinho en Janssen vast|trans-title=AZ signs Coutinho and Janssen|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/az-legt-coutinho-en-janssen-vast~a515e62f/|accessdate=8 June 2016|work=[[Algemeen Dagblad]]|date=27 June 2015|language=Dutch}}</ref> He scored his first official goal for the club against [[İstanbul Başakşehir F.K.|İstanbul Başakşehir]] in a [[UEFA Europa League]] [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League qualifying phase and play-off round|qualifier]] on 30 July 2015.<ref>{{cite news|title=AZ-spits Janssen: "Die keeper moet niet zo wild doen"|trans-title=Az Striker Janssen:"The keeper doesn't have to act so wild"|url=http://www.fcupdate.nl/voetbalnieuws/281116/az-spits-janssen-die-keeper-moet-niet-zo-wild-doen/|accessdate=9 July 2016|work=FCupdate|date=31 July 2015|language=Dutch}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Uefa Europa League result AZ Alkmaar vs Istanbul BB|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2016/matches/round=2000656/match=2016806/index.html}}</ref> His first goal in the [[Eredivisie]] was on 4 October 2015, where he scored the first and second goal in a 3–1 home win against [[FC Twente|Twente]].<ref>{{cite news|title=AZ wacht tegen FC Twente lang op beloning|trans-title=Az has to wait a bit for the reward against FC Twente|url=http://nos.nl/artikel/2061233-az-wacht-tegen-fc-twente-lang-op-beloning.html|accessdate=9 July 2016|work=NOS.nl|date=4 October 2015|language=Dutch}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=AZ Alkmaar vs FC Twente|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/az-alkmaar-vs-twente/339254}}</ref> After failing to score in his first eight matches for the club, he went on to score 20 league goals in the second half of the season – the first player to achieve this feat in 52 years<ref name="skysports"/> – and became the top scorer of the Eredivisie with a total of 27 goals. This also made him the youngest player to score more than 25 goals in an Eredivisie season since [[Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)|Ronaldo]] in the [[1994–95 Eredivisie|1994–95 season]].<ref name="ad.nl">[http://www.ad.nl/ad/nl/1442/AZ/article/detail/4296635/2016/05/08/Vincent-Janssen-topscorer-van-de-Eredivisie.dhtml Vincent Janssen Topscorer van de Eredivisie], Ad.nl</ref><ref name="goal">{{cite web|last1=McVitie|first1=Peter|title=Vincent Janssen – The Eredivisie star who can shine for Tottenham|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1862/premier-league/2016/06/10/24473622/vincent-janssen-the-eredivisie-star-who-can-shine-for|website=Goal|accessdate=2 July 2016|date=10 June 2016}}</ref> His first hat-trick for AZ was on 24 January 2016, in a 4–2 home win against former club [[Feyenoord]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Janssen Hat-trick sees AZ Alkmaar stun Feyenoord|url=http://www.football-oranje.com/janssen-hat-trick-sees-az-alkmaar-stun-feyenoord/|website=football-oranje|accessdate=9 July 2016}}</ref> He also scored four goals in a 5–1 home win against [[PEC Zwolle]] on 16 April 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=Janssen leidt AZ met vier treffers langs PEC Zwolle |trans-title=Janssen leads AZ with 4 goals along PEC Zwolle|url=http://nos.nl/artikel/2099620-janssen-leidt-az-met-vier-treffers-langs-pec-zwolle.html|accessdate=9 July 2016|work=NOS.nl|date=16 April 2016|language=Dutch}}</ref> He was awarded the 2016 [[Dutch Footballer of the Year#Dutch Football Talent of the Year .28Young player.29|Johan Cruyff Trophy]], the Dutch "Talent of the Year" award.<ref name="goal"/><ref name="cruyff award">{{cite web|title=Johan Cruyff Award|url=http://www.cruyff-foundation.org/en/johan-cruyff-award/|website=Cruyff Foundation|accessdate=2 July 2016}}</ref>
===Tottenham Hotspur=== On 12 July 2016, Janssen joined [[Premier League]] side [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] for [[Pound sterling|£]]17 million ([[Euro|€]]20 million) on a four-year contract.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/janssen-move-secured-120716/|title=Janssen move secured|date=12 July 2016|work=tottenhamhotspur.com|accessdate=12 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.itv.com/news/2016-07-12/spurs-sign-17m-dutch-striker-janssen/?|title=Spurs sign £17m Dutch striker Janssen|date=12 July 2016|work=itv.com|accessdate=12 July 2016}}</ref> Manager [[Mauricio Pochettino]] had seen Janssen during a [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] friendly with the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]], saying Janssen "ticked all the boxes we needed". With his signing, he became the most expensive player sold by AZ Alkmaar in their football history.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Kilpatrick|first1=Dan|title=Tottenham Hotspur sign Netherlands international striker Vincent Janssen|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2911444/tottenham-sign-netherlands-international-striker-vincent-janssen|accessdate=12 July 2016|work=ESPNFC|date=12 July 2016}}</ref>
Janssen played in [[2016–17 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|three friendlies]] for Tottenham before the [[2016–17 Premier League|2016–17 season]], providing a goal and an assist in the final game against [[Inter Milan]]. Janssen made his Premier League debut on 13 August, coming on as a substitute for [[Eric Dier]] against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]. He made his first start the next week at home to [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], playing at forward the full 90 minutes. Following an ankle injury to star [[Harry Kane]] on 18 September, Janssen was thrust into a larger role for the club, with Pochettino stating "this is a big opportunity for him to show what he can do".<ref name="espnfc2">{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.us/tottenham-hotspur/story/2955008/tottenhams-mauricio-pochettino-time-for-vincent-janssen-to-step-up |title=Tottenham's Mauricio Pochettino: Time for Vincent Janssen to step up |work=ESPN FC |first=Dan |last=Kilpatrick |date=20 September 2016}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on 21 September 2016, converting a penalty in a 5–0 victory in the [[2016–17 EFL Cup|EFL Cup]] against [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Allnutt|first1=Tom|title=Tottenham news: Vincent Janssen keen to impress for Spurs in absence of injured Harry Kane|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/tottenham-news-vincent-janssen-keen-to-impress-for-spurs-in-absence-of-injured-harry-kane-a7323001.html|accessdate=23 September 2016|work=The Independent|date=22 September 2016}}</ref> His first Premier League goal, another penalty, was on 29 October in a 1–1 draw with [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.football-oranje.com/janssen-ends-wait-first-premier-league-goal/ |title=Janssen ends wait for first Premier League goal |work=football-oranje.com|accessdate=30 October 2016}}</ref> He scored his first goal from open play for Tottenham on 12 March 2017, scoring the fifth goal in a 6–0 FA Cup Quarter Final win over [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/first-team/match/report/spurs-v-millwall-match-report-120317/|title=Spurs 6-0 Millwall - match in focus 12 March 2017 - News - tottenhamhotspur.com|website=www.tottenhamhotspur.com|language=en|access-date=13 March 2017}}</ref> On 4 September 2017, it was confirmed that Janssen had been omitted from Spurs' Champions League squad for the 2017–18 campaign.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/tottenham-champions-league-squad-list-erik-lamela-vincent-janssen-left-out-a7928951.html|title=Erik Lamela and Vincent Janssen left out of Tottenham's Champions League squad with only 21 players named |work=The Independent|accessdate=4 September 2017}}</ref>
On 8 September 2017, Janssen joined [[Süper Lig]] club [[Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)|Fenerbahçe]] for the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Vincent Janssen joins Fenerbahce from Tottenham on season's loan|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/sep/08/fenerbahce-vincent-janssen-tottenham-loan|publisher=The Guardian|date=8 September 2017 |accessdate=8 September 2017}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on his debut in Turkey in a 4–1 win over [[Alanyaspor]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2017/09/18/spurs-flop-vincent-janssen-showing-newcastle-united-what-they-co/ |title=Spurs flop Vincent Janssen showing Newcastle United what they could have had |first=Danny |last=Owen |work=HITC |date=18 September 2017}}</ref> and a second in the Istanbul derby against [[Beşiktaş J.K.|Beşiktaş]] that resulted in a 2–1 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/vincent-janssen-says-he-has-found-salvation-at-fenerbahce-after-leaving-tottenham-a3642411.html |title=Vincent Janssen says he has found 'salvation' at Fenerbahce after leaving Tottenham |first=James |last= Benge |work= Evening Standard |date=25 September 2017 }}</ref> However, he was injured against [[Bursaspor]] in early December, and was out of action for a few months.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://sportwitness.co.uk/tottenham-worry-injury-causing-increasing-concern-surgery-risky-reports-germany/ |title=Tottenham worry as injury causing increasing concern, surgery risky, reports to Germany|date= 26 January 2018 |work=Sport Witness }}</ref>
In summer 2018 Janssen returned to Tottenham but at the beginning of the 2018–19 season he was not issued a number.<ref name="201819skysports">{{cite web |title=Tottenham striker Vincent Janssen undergoes minor foot surgery |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11675/11478440/tottenham-striker-vincent-janssen-undergoes-minor-foot-surgery |website=Sky Sports |accessdate=4 November 2018 |date=21 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/teams/first-team/players/ |title=First Team |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur Football Club |accessdate=26 August 2018}}</ref> Spurs reported on their website that Janssen had surgery for a foot injury and would be in recovery with the club's medical staff.<ref name="201819skysports"/><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/2018/august/janssen-injury-update/ |title=Janssen injury update |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur Football Club |date=21 August 2018 |accessdate=26 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Janssen received his first call up to the senior [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands team]] in March 2016 for friendlies against [[France national football team|France]] and [[England national football team|England]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Arjen Robben pulls out of Holland squad to face France and England with a thigh injury|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3497216/Arjen-Robben-pulls-Holland-squad-face-France-England-thigh-injury.html|accessdate=18 March 2016|publisher=dailymail.co.uk|date=17 March 2016}}</ref> In his first international start, a 1–2 win against England on 29 March 2016, he scored his first senior international goal and provided his first assist on the other.<ref>{{cite news|title=England suffer double Dutch blow after Jamie Vardy strike thrills Wembley|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/pa/article-3514689/England-suffer-double-Dutch-blow-Jamie-Vardy-strike-thrills-Wembley.html|accessdate=30 March 2016|publisher=dailymail.co.uk|date=30 March 2016}}</ref>
==Style of play== [[File:Vincent_Janssen_Penalty_(25866552990).jpg|thumb|300px|Vincent Janssen lining up to take a penalty against England in March 2016.]]
A two-footed player,<ref name="goal"/><ref name="fourfourtwo">{{cite web|last1=Ramesh|first1=Priya|title=All about Vincent Janssen: The Eredivisie top scorer wooing Wenger and Arsenal|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/vincent-janssen-dutchman-wooing-arsenal-liverpool-and-manchester|website=FourFourTwo|accessdate=2 July 2016|date=10 May 2016}}</ref> Janssen is credited with good finishing, movement and pace.<ref name="skysports"/><ref name="fourfourtwo"/><ref name="outside">{{cite web|last1=Lynch|first1=Alex|title=Scout Report: Vincent Janssen|url=http://outsideoftheboot.com/2016/04/19/36320/|website=Outside of the boot|accessdate=2 July 2016|date=19 April 2016}}</ref> Due to his strength,<ref name="skysports"/><ref name="goal"/><ref name="fourfourtwo"/> he is an "exceptional" hold-up man<ref name="skysports"/> who can bring teammates into play,<ref name="goal"/> and as a good passer of the ball,<ref name="skysports"/><ref name="fourfourtwo"/><ref name="outside"/> he can set up goal-scoring opportunities for teammates.<ref name="bleacher">{{cite web|last1=McNicholas|first1=James|title=Who Is Vincent Janssen and What Would He Bring to Arsenal?|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2638363-who-is-vincent-janssen-and-what-would-he-bring-to-arsenal|website=Bleacher Report|accessdate=2 July 2016|date=6 May 2016}}</ref> He is also praised for his work ethic,<ref name="skysports"/><ref name="fourfourtwo"/> as well as his competitive mentality.<ref name="espnfc2"/> Janssen's style of play has invited comparisons with [[Ruud van Nistelrooy]].<ref name="skysports"/><ref name="espnfc"/>
His weaknesses are shots from outside the penalty box, the timing of his movement and ball control.<ref name="fourfourtwo"/>
==Personal life== Janssen is the son of [[Annemarie Verstappen]], a former world champion swimmer and [[Dutch Sportswoman of the year]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Wilson|first1=Jeremy|title=Arsenal transfer news: Holland striker Vincent Janssen a summer target|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/05/05/arsenal-transfer-news-holland-striker-vincent-janssen-a-summer-t/|accessdate=8 June 2016|work=The Telegraph|date=5 May 2016}}</ref>
==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 8 January 2019}}<ref name=SW>{{Soccerway|vincent-janssen/303286}}</ref>

(on loan from [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]) | clubnumber = 7 | youthyears1 = {{0|0000}}–2015 | youthclubs1 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C. Villa]] (loan) | caps2 = 33 | goals2 = 4 | years3 = 2018– | clubs3 = → [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] (loan) | caps3 = 12 | goals3 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2012–2013 | nationalteam1 = nationalcaps6 = 8 | nationalgoals6 = 2 | club-update = 22:20, 2 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 18:29, 16 October 2018 (UTC) }} '''Joshua Oghenetega Peter Onomah''' (born 27 April 1997) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]], on loan from [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].{{Cite news|title=Josh Onomah checks in|url=https://www.swfc.co.uk/news/2018/august/josh-onomah-checks-in/|publisher=Sheff Wed Official Site|date=31 August 2018|accessdate=31 August 2018}} Onomah has been a regular youth international for [[England national football team|England]], including winning the [[2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] and the [[2014 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship]]. ==Club career== ===Tottenham Hotspur=== Born in [[London Borough of Enfield|Enfield]],{{cite web|title=JOSHUA ONOMAH|url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/second-year-academy/joshua-onomah/|publisher=[[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.]]|accessdate=15 January 2015}}, Onomah came through the academy system at [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]. He was first called up for the first team on 5 January 2015, remaining an unused substitute in their 1–1 draw away to [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] in the [[FA Cup]] third round,{{cite news|last1=Dawkes|first1=Phil|title=Burnley 1–1 Tottenham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30620968|accessdate=1 June 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=5 January 2015}} and made his debut nine days later in the replay, replacing [[Andros Townsend]] for the last 15 minutes of a 4–2 victory at [[White Hart Lane]].{{cite news|last1=McMath|first1=James|title=Tottenham 4–2 Burnley|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30706058|accessdate=15 January 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=14 January 2015}} On 24 May, he was included in the matchday squad for a [[Premier League]] game for the first time, remaining unused as Tottenham won 0–1 at [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in the last game of the season.{{cite news|last1=Magowan|first1=Alistair|title=Everton 0–1 Tottenham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32770847|accessdate=1 June 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=24 May 2015}} In the 2015–16 season, Onomah changed his shirt number to 25, which was included on the club's list of first-team numbers.{{cite web|title=2015–16 Premier League squad numbers announced|url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/squad-numbers-070815/|publisher=Tottenham Hotspur|accessdate=6 November 2015|date=7 August 2015}} He made his Premier League debut in a 3–1 home victory over [[Aston Villa]] on 2 November 2015, replacing [[Dele Alli]] for the final minutes.{{cite news|last1=Magowan|first1=Alistair|title=Tottenham 3–1 Aston Villa|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34634659|accessdate=3 November 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 November 2015}} On 10 December, Onomah made his first start for Tottenham playing 90 minutes in a 4–1 victory over [[AS Monaco]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35055753|title=Tottenham Hotspur 4–1 Monaco|date=10 December 2015|publisher=|via=www.bbc.co.uk}} ====Loan to Aston Villa==== On 4 August 2017, Onomah joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on loan for the season.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/aug/04/tottenham-josh-onomah-aston-villa-loan|title=Transfer roundup: Tottenham’s Josh Onomah joins Aston Villa on loan|website=Guardian|last=Hytner|first=David|date=4 August 2017|accessdate=4 August 2017}} He scored his first goal for Aston Villa in a 1–1 draw at [[Bristol City]] on 25 August 2017.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40970867 |title=Bristol City 1–1 Aston Villa |publisher=BBC |date=25 August 2017 |accessdate=29 August 2017}} ====Loan to Sheffield Wednesday==== On 31 August 2018, Onomah joined Championship side [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] on loan for the season.{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/transfer/news/11703/11486788/tottenhams-josh-onomah-joins-sheffield-wednesday-on-loan|title=Josh Onomah joins Sheffield Wednesday on loan|website=SkySports|date=31 August 2018|accessdate=31 August 2018}} ==International career== Onomah has represented England up to under-21 level. In May 2014, Onomah was part of the [[England national under-17 football team|England squad]] that won the [[2014 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]], playing the full 90 minutes in the final against the [[Netherlands national under-17 football team|Netherlands]].{{cite news|title=Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Joshua Onomah helped England win Under-17 European Championship against the Netherlands tonight|url=http://www.croydonguardian.co.uk/sport/football/premierleague/news_articles/11228327.Spurs_midfielder_helps_England_win_Under_17_European_Championship/|accessdate=15 January 2015|work=[[Croydon Guardian]]|date=21 May 2014}} In 2015, Onomah scored the equaliser against [[Croatia national under-19 football team|Croatia U-19]] in a 1–1 draw.{{cite news|last1=Shergold|first1=Adam|title=Croatia U19 1–1 England U19: Josh Onomah salvages friendly draw for the Young Lions|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3226455/Croatia-U19-1-1-England-U19-Josh-Onomah-salvages-draw-Young-Lions.html|accessdate=6 November 2015|work=Daily Mail|date=8 September 2015}} During the elite round of [[2016 UEFA European Under-19 Championship qualification]], held in March 2016, Onomah scored in wins against [[Georgia national under-19 football team|Georgia]] and group hosts [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain]] as England qualified for the final tournament by winning the group.[http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2016/matches/round=2000602/match=2019176/postmatch/index.html"Under-19 2016 – England-Georgia"] UEFA.com. 24 March 2016. Retrieved 30 March 2016.[http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2016/matches/round=2000602/match=2019203/index.html"Under-19 2016 – England-Spain"] UEFA.com. 29 March 2016. Retrieved 30 March 2016. Onomah represented England at the 2016 UEFA European Under-19 Championship and made 4 appearances in the tournament where England finished semi-finalists.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2016/matches/round=2000598/match=2019792/index.html |title=England hold off France fightback|date= 12 July 2016 |work=UEFA.com }} ===2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup=== Onomah was in the [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20 team]] in the [[2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup]]. He received a red card in the quarter-finals match against [[Mexico national under-20 football team|Mexico]], so he missed the semi-final against [[Italy national under-20 football team|Italy]].{{cite news |url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40158561 |title=Under-20 World Cup: England beat Mexico 1–0 to reach semi-finals |date= 5 June 2017 |work=BBC Sport }} He returned for the final where England beat [[Venezuela national under-20 football team|Venezuela]] 1–0, which is England's first win in a global tournament since their [[1966 FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] victory of 1966.{{cite news |url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40237981 |title= Under-20 World Cup: England beat Venezuela in final |work=BBC Sport |date= 11 June 2017 | }} ==Club statistics== {{updated|match played 2
